Python Code python
import json import os from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file to understand its structure scraped_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_scraped_20250807_090529.json' if os.path.exists(scraped_file): print("Found scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") with open(scraped_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: scraped_data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(scraped_data.keys())}") print(f"Scraping timestamp: {scraped_data.get('scraping_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total sources: {scraped_data.get('total_sources', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_content' in scraped_data and len(scraped_data['scraped_content']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped content structure:") first_content = scraped_data['scraped_content'][0] print(f"Keys in content: {list(first_content.keys())}") # Show sample of each successful scrape print("\n" + "="*80) print("SUCCESSFUL SCRAPES OVERVIEW:") print("="*80) for i, content in enumerate(scraped_data['scraped_content']): if 'error' not in content: print(f"\nSource {content.get('source_number', i+1)}: {content.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f"URL: {content.get('url', 'No URL')}") print(f"Content length: {content.get('content_length', 0)} characters") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}") print("-" * 60) print("\n" + "="*80) print("ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION") print("="*80) # Now let's properly analyze the content for relevant information relevant_findings = [] general_prosecutor_info = [] for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' in content: print(f"\n‚ùå Skipped {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - Error: {content.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") continue found_keywords = content.get('found_keywords', []) full_text = content.get('full_text', '').lower() title = content.get('title', 'No title') url = content.get('url', 'No URL') print(f"\nüîç Analyzing: {title}") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(found_keywords)}") # Look for specific combinations indicating 1823 legislation if '1823' in found_keywords: print(f"üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...") # Search for context around 1823 import re year_pattern = r'.{0,200}1823.{0,200}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"Context around 1823: ...{match.strip()}...") # Check if this context mentions prosecutors, attorneys, or legislation context_lower = match.lower() if any(term in context_lower for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'legislation', 'mandated', 'required']): print(f"‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions legal/prosecutor terms!") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1823', 'context': match.strip(), 'relevance': 'high' }) # Look for any prosecutor-related information if any(term in found_keywords for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney']): print(f"üìã Contains prosecutor information - examining...") # Search for New Jersey specific prosecutor information nj_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,300}(new jersey|nj).{0,100}(prosecutor|prosecuting attorney).{0,300}' nj_matches = re.findall(nj_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in nj_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"NJ Prosecutor context: ...{context[:300]}...") # Check for county mentions nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context.lower()] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Counties mentioned: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:500], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties }) # Look for 1843 information (when prosecuting attorney positions were established) if '1843' in full_text: print(f"üìÖ Contains 1843 - examining for prosecuting attorney establishment...") year_pattern = r'.{0,200}1843.{0,200}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"1843 context: ...{match.strip()}...") if any(term in match.lower() for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'established']): print(f"‚≠ê 1843 context mentions prosecutor establishment!") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1843', 'context': match.strip(), 'relevance': 'medium' }) print("-" * 70) # Summarize findings print(f"\n\nüìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f"Relevant findings (1823/1843 + prosecutor terms): {len(relevant_findings)}") print(f"General prosecutor information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}") if relevant_findings: print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT FINDINGS FOR NJ PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION:") print("=" * 60) for i, finding in enumerate(relevant_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Year: {finding['year']}") print(f" URL: {finding['url']}") print(f" Context: {finding['context'][:300]}...") print(f" Relevance: {finding['relevance']}") if general_prosecutor_info: print(f"\nüìã GENERAL NJ PROSECUTOR INFORMATION:") print("=" * 50) for i, info in enumerate(general_prosecutor_info[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. Source: {info['source']}") print(f" URL: {info['url']}") print(f" Context: {info['context'][:200]}...") if info['counties_mentioned']: print(f" Counties: {', '.join(info['counties_mentioned']).upper()}") # Save detailed analysis results analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_1823_legislation_analysis_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_focus': 'New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation and first county implementation', 'sources_analyzed': scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0), 'relevant_findings_count': len(relevant_findings), 'general_prosecutor_info_count': len(general_prosecutor_info), 'relevant_findings': relevant_findings, 'general_prosecutor_info': general_prosecutor_info, 'research_status': 'Partial - need specialized legal history sources for 1823 legislation details' }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Detailed analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create comprehensive summary summary_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION RESEARCH SUMMARY\n") f.write("=" * 65 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Research conducted: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Method: Direct web scraping (SerpAPI quota exhausted)\n") f.write(f"Sources successfully scraped: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}\n") f.write(f"Relevant findings: {len(relevant_findings)}\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH OBJECTIVES STATUS:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation - PARTIAL (found 1823 reference)\n") f.write("2. Licensed attorney requirement details - NOT FOUND in current sources\n") f.write("3. First county to implement requirement - NOT IDENTIFIED yet\n") f.write("4. Cross-reference with 1843 prosecuting attorney positions - IN PROGRESS\n\n") f.write("KEY FINDINGS:\n") if relevant_findings: for finding in relevant_findings: f.write(f"- {finding['year']}: {finding['source']}\n") f.write(f" Context: {finding['context'][:200]}...\n\n") else: f.write("- No specific 1823 prosecutor legislation details found in current sources\n") f.write("- General prosecutor information available but lacks historical specifics\n\n") f.write("RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FURTHER RESEARCH:\n") f.write("1. Search New Jersey State Archives (archives.nj.gov)\n") f.write("2. Check New Jersey Law Library historical collections\n") f.write("3. Review county historical society records\n") f.write("4. Search academic legal history databases (HeinOnline, Westlaw)\n") f.write("5. Examine New Jersey Statutes at Large for 1823\n") print(f"üìã Research summary saved to: {summary_file}") if not relevant_findings: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è CONCLUSION: Current web scraping did not find specific details about the 1823 legislation") print("üí° RECOMMENDATION: Need to access specialized legal history databases or archives") print("üéØ NEXT STEP: Try New Jersey State Archives or academic legal databases") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ PROGRESS: Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references") print("üîç NEXT STEP: Analyze these findings for specific county implementation details") else: print(f"‚ùå Scraped data file not found: {scraped_file}") print("Need to run web scraping first to collect data for analysis")

Python Code python
import json import os import re from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file to understand its structure scraped_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_scraped_20250807_090529.json' if os.path.exists(scraped_file): print("Found scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") with open(scraped_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: scraped_data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(scraped_data.keys())}") print(f"Scraping timestamp: {scraped_data.get('scraping_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total sources: {scraped_data.get('total_sources', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_content' in scraped_data and len(scraped_data['scraped_content']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped content structure:") first_content = scraped_data['scraped_content'][0] print(f"Keys in content: {list(first_content.keys())}") # Show sample of each successful scrape print("\n" + "="*80) print("SUCCESSFUL SCRAPES OVERVIEW:") print("="*80) for i, content in enumerate(scraped_data['scraped_content']): if 'error' not in content: print(f"\nSource {content.get('source_number', i+1)}: {content.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f"URL: {content.get('url', 'No URL')}") print(f"Content length: {content.get('content_length', 0)} characters") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}") print("-" * 60) print("\n" + "="*80) print("ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION") print("="*80) # Now let's properly analyze the content for relevant information relevant_findings = [] general_prosecutor_info = [] for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' in content: print(f"\n‚ùå Skipped {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - Error: {content.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") continue found_keywords = content.get('found_keywords', []) full_text = content.get('full_text', '').lower() title = content.get('title', 'No title') url = content.get('url', 'No URL') print(f"\nüîç Analyzing: {title}") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(found_keywords)}") # Look for specific combinations indicating 1823 legislation if '1823' in found_keywords: print(f"üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...") # Search for context around 1823 year_pattern = r'.{0,200}1823.{0,200}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"Context around 1823: ...{match.strip()}...") # Check if this context mentions prosecutors, attorneys, or legislation # FIX: Define context_lower before using it context_lower = match.lower() if any(term in context_lower for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'legislation', 'mandated', 'required']): print(f"‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions legal/prosecutor terms!") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1823', 'context': match.strip(), 'relevance': 'high' }) else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è 1823 context does not mention prosecutor/legal terms") # Look for any prosecutor-related information if any(term in found_keywords for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney']): print(f"üìã Contains prosecutor information - examining...") # Search for New Jersey specific prosecutor information nj_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,300}(new jersey|nj).{0,100}(prosecutor|prosecuting attorney).{0,300}' nj_matches = re.findall(nj_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in nj_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"NJ Prosecutor context: ...{context[:300]}...") # Check for county mentions nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context.lower()] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Counties mentioned: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:500], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties }) # Look for 1843 information (when prosecuting attorney positions were established) if '1843' in full_text: print(f"üìÖ Contains 1843 - examining for prosecuting attorney establishment...") year_pattern = r'.{0,200}1843.{0,200}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"1843 context: ...{match.strip()}...") if any(term in match.lower() for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'established']): print(f"‚≠ê 1843 context mentions prosecutor establishment!") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1843', 'context': match.strip(), 'relevance': 'medium' }) # Look for any mention of counties with prosecutor/attorney context if 'county' in found_keywords: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Contains county information - checking for prosecutor context...") # Search for county + prosecutor combinations county_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,200}(county).{0,100}(prosecutor|attorney|legislation).{0,200}' county_matches = re.findall(county_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in county_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"County-prosecutor context: ...{context[:200]}...") # Check if this mentions specific NJ counties nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context.lower()] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üéØ SPECIFIC NJ COUNTIES: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:400], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'county_prosecutor_context' }) print("-" * 70) # Summarize findings print(f"\n\nüìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f"Relevant findings (1823/1843 + prosecutor terms): {len(relevant_findings)}") print(f"General prosecutor information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}") if relevant_findings: print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT FINDINGS FOR NJ PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION:") print("=" * 60) for i, finding in enumerate(relevant_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Year: {finding['year']}") print(f" URL: {finding['url']}") print(f" Context: {finding['context'][:300]}...") print(f" Relevance: {finding['relevance']}") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No direct references to 1823 prosecutor legislation found") if general_prosecutor_info: print(f"\nüìã GENERAL NJ PROSECUTOR INFORMATION:") print("=" * 50) for i, info in enumerate(general_prosecutor_info[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f"\n{i}. Source: {info['source']}") print(f" URL: {info['url']}") print(f" Context: {info['context'][:200]}...") if info.get('counties_mentioned'): print(f" Counties: {', '.join(info['counties_mentioned']).upper()}") print(f" Type: {info.get('type', 'general')}") # Save detailed analysis results analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_1823_legislation_analysis_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_focus': 'New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation and first county implementation', 'sources_analyzed': scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0), 'relevant_findings_count': len(relevant_findings), 'general_prosecutor_info_count': len(general_prosecutor_info), 'relevant_findings': relevant_findings, 'general_prosecutor_info': general_prosecutor_info, 'research_status': 'Completed initial analysis - need specialized legal history sources for specific 1823 legislation details' }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Detailed analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create comprehensive summary with actionable next steps summary_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION RESEARCH - FINAL SUMMARY\n") f.write("=" * 70 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Research conducted: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Method: Direct web scraping analysis (SerpAPI quota exhausted)\n") f.write(f"Sources successfully analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}\n") f.write(f"Relevant findings: {len(relevant_findings)}\n") f.write(f"General prosecutor information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH OBJECTIVES STATUS:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation - NOT FOUND in current sources\n") f.write("2. Licensed attorney requirement details - NOT FOUND in current sources\n") f.write("3. First county to implement requirement - NOT IDENTIFIED\n") f.write("4. Cross-reference with 1843 prosecuting attorney positions - PARTIAL\n\n") f.write("SOURCES ANALYZED:\n") for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' not in content: f.write(f"- {content.get('title', 'No title')} ({content.get('url', 'No URL')})\n") f.write(f" Keywords: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("KEY FINDINGS:\n") if relevant_findings: for finding in relevant_findings: f.write(f"- {finding['year']}: {finding['source']}\n") f.write(f" Context: {finding['context'][:200]}...\n\n") else: f.write("- No specific 1823 prosecutor legislation details found\n") f.write("- Found general prosecutor information but lacks historical specifics\n") f.write("- 1823 reference found but relates to Attorney General death date, not legislation\n\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("The current web scraping approach did not locate specific information about\n") f.write("New Jersey's 1823 state legislation mandating licensed attorneys as prosecutors\n") f.write("or identify which county was first to implement this requirement.\n\n") f.write("RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS FOR SPECIALIZED RESEARCH:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey State Archives (www.nj.gov/state/archives/)\n") f.write("2. New Jersey State Library Law Collection\n") f.write("3. Rutgers Law Library Historical Collections\n") f.write("4. HeinOnline legal database for NJ Statutes at Large 1823\n") f.write("5. New Jersey Historical Society archives\n") f.write("6. County historical societies for implementation records\n") f.write("7. Academic legal history journals on NJ prosecutor development\n") print(f"üìã Final research summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n\nüèÅ RESEARCH PHASE COMPLETE") print("=" * 50) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully analyzed {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)} web sources") print(f"üìä Found {len(relevant_findings)} relevant findings and {len(general_prosecutor_info)} general prosecutor references") if not relevant_findings: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è CONCLUSION: Specific 1823 legislation details not found in publicly available web sources") print("üí° RECOMMENDATION: Research requires access to specialized legal history archives") print("üéØ NEXT STEP: Contact New Jersey State Archives or academic law libraries") print("\nüìö The 1823 legislation and first county implementation details likely exist in:") print(" - New Jersey Statutes at Large (1823)") print(" - County court records from 1823-1843 period") print(" - New Jersey Legislative journals from 1823") print(" - Academic legal history dissertations on NJ prosecutor development") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ PROGRESS: Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references") print("üîç NEXT STEP: Follow up on these leads for specific county implementation details") else: print(f"‚ùå Scraped data file not found: {scraped_file}") print("Need to run web scraping first to collect data for analysis")

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered the same NameError on line 74 where 'context_lower' is referenced in a generator expression before being defined. The code successfully loaded the scraped data file and began analyzing the Attorney General Wikipedia page that contains '1823', but failed when checking if the context around 1823 mentions prosecutor-related terms. The error shows 'context_lower' is used in the conditional check before being defined from 'match.lower()'. **PLAN** alignment: 50% - data structure inspection completed successfully, but the critical content analysis phase failed due to the variable definition error. Recommended fix: Move the line 'context_lower = match.lower()' to occur BEFORE the conditional check that uses it (before the 'if any(term in context_lower...)' statement), then complete the analysis to extract 1823 prosecutor legislation details from the successfully scraped sources.
Python Code python
import json import os import re from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the scraped data file to understand its structure scraped_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_scraped_20250807_090529.json' if os.path.exists(scraped_file): print("Found scraped data file. Inspecting structure...") with open(scraped_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: scraped_data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(scraped_data.keys())}") print(f"Scraping timestamp: {scraped_data.get('scraping_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total sources: {scraped_data.get('total_sources', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") if 'scraped_content' in scraped_data and len(scraped_data['scraped_content']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst scraped content structure:") first_content = scraped_data['scraped_content'][0] print(f"Keys in content: {list(first_content.keys())}") # Show sample of each successful scrape print("\n" + "="*80) print("SUCCESSFUL SCRAPES OVERVIEW:") print("="*80) for i, content in enumerate(scraped_data['scraped_content']): if 'error' not in content: print(f"\nSource {content.get('source_number', i+1)}: {content.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f"URL: {content.get('url', 'No URL')}") print(f"Content length: {content.get('content_length', 0)} characters") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}") print("-" * 60) print("\n" + "="*80) print("ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION") print("="*80) # Now let's properly analyze the content for relevant information relevant_findings = [] general_prosecutor_info = [] for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' in content: print(f"\n‚ùå Skipped {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - Error: {content.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") continue found_keywords = content.get('found_keywords', []) full_text = content.get('full_text', '').lower() title = content.get('title', 'No title') url = content.get('url', 'No URL') print(f"\nüîç Analyzing: {title}") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(found_keywords)}") # Look for specific combinations indicating 1823 legislation if '1823' in found_keywords: print(f"üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...") # Search for context around 1823 year_pattern = r'.{0,200}1823.{0,200}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"Context around 1823: ...{match.strip()}...") # Check if this context mentions prosecutors, attorneys, or legislation # FIX: Define context_lower before using it context_lower = match.lower() if any(term in context_lower for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'legislation', 'mandated', 'required']): print(f"‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions legal/prosecutor terms!") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1823', 'context': match.strip(), 'relevance': 'high' }) else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è 1823 context does not mention prosecutor/legal terms") # Look for any prosecutor-related information if any(term in found_keywords for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney']): print(f"üìã Contains prosecutor information - examining...") # Search for New Jersey specific prosecutor information nj_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,300}(new jersey|nj).{0,100}(prosecutor|prosecuting attorney).{0,300}' nj_matches = re.findall(nj_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in nj_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"NJ Prosecutor context: ...{context[:300]}...") # Check for county mentions nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context.lower()] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Counties mentioned: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:500], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties }) # Look for 1843 information (when prosecuting attorney positions were established) if '1843' in full_text: print(f"üìÖ Contains 1843 - examining for prosecuting attorney establishment...") year_pattern = r'.{0,200}1843.{0,200}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"1843 context: ...{match.strip()}...") if any(term in match.lower() for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'established']): print(f"‚≠ê 1843 context mentions prosecutor establishment!") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1843', 'context': match.strip(), 'relevance': 'medium' }) # Look for any mention of counties with prosecutor/attorney context if 'county' in found_keywords: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Contains county information - checking for prosecutor context...") # Search for county + prosecutor combinations county_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,200}(county).{0,100}(prosecutor|attorney|legislation).{0,200}' county_matches = re.findall(county_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in county_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"County-prosecutor context: ...{context[:200]}...") # Check if this mentions specific NJ counties nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context.lower()] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üéØ SPECIFIC NJ COUNTIES: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:400], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'county_prosecutor_context' }) print("-" * 70) # Summarize findings print(f"\n\nüìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f"Relevant findings (1823/1843 + prosecutor terms): {len(relevant_findings)}") print(f"General prosecutor information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}") if relevant_findings: print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT FINDINGS FOR NJ PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION:") print("=" * 60) for i, finding in enumerate(relevant_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Year: {finding['year']}") print(f" URL: {finding['url']}") print(f" Context: {finding['context'][:300]}...") print(f" Relevance: {finding['relevance']}") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No direct references to 1823 prosecutor legislation found") if general_prosecutor_info: print(f"\nüìã GENERAL NJ PROSECUTOR INFORMATION:") print("=" * 50) for i, info in enumerate(general_prosecutor_info[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f"\n{i}. Source: {info['source']}") print(f" URL: {info['url']}") print(f" Context: {info['context'][:200]}...") if info.get('counties_mentioned'): print(f" Counties: {', '.join(info['counties_mentioned']).upper()}") print(f" Type: {info.get('type', 'general')}") # Save detailed analysis results analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_1823_legislation_analysis_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_focus': 'New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation and first county implementation', 'sources_analyzed': scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0), 'relevant_findings_count': len(relevant_findings), 'general_prosecutor_info_count': len(general_prosecutor_info), 'relevant_findings': relevant_findings, 'general_prosecutor_info': general_prosecutor_info, 'research_status': 'Completed initial analysis - need specialized legal history sources for specific 1823 legislation details' }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Detailed analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create comprehensive summary with actionable next steps summary_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_final_summary.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION RESEARCH - FINAL SUMMARY\n") f.write("=" * 70 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Research conducted: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Method: Direct web scraping analysis (SerpAPI quota exhausted)\n") f.write(f"Sources successfully analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}\n") f.write(f"Relevant findings: {len(relevant_findings)}\n") f.write(f"General prosecutor information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH OBJECTIVES STATUS:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation - NOT FOUND in current sources\n") f.write("2. Licensed attorney requirement details - NOT FOUND in current sources\n") f.write("3. First county to implement requirement - NOT IDENTIFIED\n") f.write("4. Cross-reference with 1843 prosecuting attorney positions - PARTIAL\n\n") f.write("SOURCES ANALYZED:\n") for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' not in content: f.write(f"- {content.get('title', 'No title')} ({content.get('url', 'No URL')})\n") f.write(f" Keywords: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("KEY FINDINGS:\n") if relevant_findings: for finding in relevant_findings: f.write(f"- {finding['year']}: {finding['source']}\n") f.write(f" Context: {finding['context'][:200]}...\n\n") else: f.write("- No specific 1823 prosecutor legislation details found\n") f.write("- Found general prosecutor information but lacks historical specifics\n") f.write("- 1823 reference found but relates to Attorney General death date, not legislation\n\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("The current web scraping approach did not locate specific information about\n") f.write("New Jersey's 1823 state legislation mandating licensed attorneys as prosecutors\n") f.write("or identify which county was first to implement this requirement.\n\n") f.write("RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS FOR SPECIALIZED RESEARCH:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey State Archives (www.nj.gov/state/archives/)\n") f.write("2. New Jersey State Library Law Collection\n") f.write("3. Rutgers Law Library Historical Collections\n") f.write("4. HeinOnline legal database for NJ Statutes at Large 1823\n") f.write("5. New Jersey Historical Society archives\n") f.write("6. County historical societies for implementation records\n") f.write("7. Academic legal history journals on NJ prosecutor development\n") print(f"üìã Final research summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n\nüèÅ RESEARCH PHASE COMPLETE") print("=" * 50) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully analyzed {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)} web sources") print(f"üìä Found {len(relevant_findings)} relevant findings and {len(general_prosecutor_info)} general prosecutor references") if not relevant_findings: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è CONCLUSION: Specific 1823 legislation details not found in publicly available web sources") print("üí° RECOMMENDATION: Research requires access to specialized legal history archives") print("üéØ NEXT STEP: Contact New Jersey State Archives or academic law libraries") print("\nüìö The 1823 legislation and first county implementation details likely exist in:") print(" - New Jersey Statutes at Large (1823)") print(" - County court records from 1823-1843 period") print(" - New Jersey Legislative journals from 1823") print(" - Academic legal history dissertations on NJ prosecutor development") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ PROGRESS: Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references") print("üîç NEXT STEP: Follow up on these leads for specific county implementation details") else: print(f"‚ùå Scraped data file not found: {scraped_file}") print("Need to run web scraping first to collect data for analysis")

Python Code python
import json import os import re from datetime import datetime # Load and inspect the scraped data file structure first scraped_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_scraped_20250807_090529.json' if os.path.exists(scraped_file): print("Loading scraped data file...") with open(scraped_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: scraped_data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure inspection:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(scraped_data.keys())}") print(f"Scraping timestamp: {scraped_data.get('scraping_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total sources: {scraped_data.get('total_sources', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") print("\n" + "="*80) print("ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION") print("="*80) # Initialize result containers relevant_findings = [] general_prosecutor_info = [] # Analyze each scraped source for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' in content: print(f"\n‚ùå Skipped {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - Error: {content.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") continue found_keywords = content.get('found_keywords', []) full_text = content.get('full_text', '').lower() title = content.get('title', 'No title') url = content.get('url', 'No URL') print(f"\nüîç Analyzing: {title}") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(found_keywords)}") print(f"Content length: {len(full_text)} characters") # Look for 1823 references with prosecutor context if '1823' in found_keywords: print(f"üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...") # Search for context around 1823 year_pattern = r'.{0,300}1823.{0,300}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"Context around 1823: ...{match.strip()[:400]}...") # FIX: Define context_lower BEFORE using it context_lower = match.lower() prosecutor_terms = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'legislation', 'mandated', 'required', 'licensed'] # Check if context mentions prosecutor/legal terms matching_terms = [term for term in prosecutor_terms if term in context_lower] if matching_terms: print(f"‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1823', 'context': match.strip(), 'matching_terms': matching_terms, 'relevance': 'high' }) else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è 1823 context does not mention prosecutor/legal terms") print(f" Context relates to: {context_lower[:200]}...") # Look for 1843 references (prosecuting attorney establishment) if '1843' in full_text: print(f"üìÖ Contains 1843 - examining for prosecuting attorney establishment...") year_pattern = r'.{0,300}1843.{0,300}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"1843 context: ...{match.strip()[:400]}...") context_lower = match.lower() prosecutor_terms = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'established', 'office', 'county'] matching_terms = [term for term in prosecutor_terms if term in context_lower] if matching_terms: print(f"‚≠ê 1843 context mentions prosecutor establishment: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1843', 'context': match.strip(), 'matching_terms': matching_terms, 'relevance': 'medium' }) # Look for New Jersey prosecutor information if any(term in found_keywords for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney']): print(f"üìã Contains prosecutor information - examining for NJ context...") # Search for New Jersey specific prosecutor information nj_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,200}(new jersey|nj).{0,200}(prosecutor|prosecuting attorney|county prosecutor).{0,200}' nj_matches = re.findall(nj_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in nj_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"NJ Prosecutor context: ...{context[:300]}...") # Check for specific NJ county mentions nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] context_lower = context.lower() mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context_lower] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Counties mentioned: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:500], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'nj_prosecutor_context' }) # Look for county information with legal context if 'county' in found_keywords: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Contains county information - checking for legal/prosecutor context...") # Search for county + legal terms combinations county_legal_pattern = r'.{0,200}(county).{0,200}(prosecutor|attorney|legislation|court|legal).{0,200}' county_matches = re.findall(county_legal_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in county_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"County-legal context: ...{context[:250]}...") # Check for specific NJ counties nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] context_lower = context.lower() mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context_lower] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üéØ SPECIFIC NJ COUNTIES: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:400], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'county_legal_context' }) print("-" * 70) # Summarize findings print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f"Sources analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}") print(f"Relevant findings (1823/1843 + prosecutor terms): {len(relevant_findings)}") print(f"General prosecutor/county information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}") if relevant_findings: print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT FINDINGS FOR NJ PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION:") print("=" * 60) for i, finding in enumerate(relevant_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Year: {finding['year']}") print(f" URL: {finding['url']}") print(f" Matching terms: {', '.join(finding['matching_terms'])}") print(f" Context: {finding['context'][:300]}...") print(f" Relevance: {finding['relevance']}") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No direct references to 1823 prosecutor legislation found") print(" The 1823 reference found relates to Attorney General Joseph Bloomfield's death date") print(" No evidence of 1823 legislation mandating licensed attorneys as prosecutors") if general_prosecutor_info: print(f"\nüìã GENERAL NJ PROSECUTOR/COUNTY INFORMATION:") print("=" * 50) for i, info in enumerate(general_prosecutor_info[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f"\n{i}. Source: {info['source']}") print(f" Type: {info.get('type', 'general')}") print(f" Context: {info['context'][:200]}...") if info.get('counties_mentioned'): print(f" Counties: {', '.join(info['counties_mentioned']).upper()}") # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_1823_legislation_final_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_focus': 'New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation and first county implementation', 'sources_analyzed': scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0), 'relevant_findings_count': len(relevant_findings), 'general_prosecutor_info_count': len(general_prosecutor_info), 'relevant_findings': relevant_findings, 'general_prosecutor_info': general_prosecutor_info, 'research_conclusion': 'No evidence found of 1823 NJ legislation mandating licensed attorney prosecutors in current web sources', 'research_status': 'Complete - requires specialized legal archives for historical legislation details' }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Complete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create final research summary with conclusions summary_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_conclusion.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION RESEARCH - FINAL CONCLUSION\n") f.write("=" * 75 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Research completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Method: Web scraping analysis (SerpAPI quota exhausted)\n") f.write(f"Sources analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH QUESTION:\n") f.write("Which New Jersey county was first to implement the 1823 state legislation\n") f.write("that mandated licensed attorneys as prosecutors?\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH FINDINGS:\n") if relevant_findings: f.write(f"Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references:\n") for finding in relevant_findings: f.write(f"- {finding['year']}: {finding['source']}\n") f.write(f" Terms: {', '.join(finding['matching_terms'])}\n") f.write(f" Context: {finding['context'][:200]}...\n\n") else: f.write("‚ùå NO EVIDENCE FOUND of 1823 New Jersey legislation mandating licensed\n") f.write(" attorneys as prosecutors in the analyzed web sources.\n\n") f.write("KEY OBSERVATION:\n") f.write("- The 1823 reference found relates to Attorney General Joseph Bloomfield's\n") f.write(" death date (1753-1823), not to prosecutor legislation\n") f.write("- No references to county implementation of prosecutor requirements\n") f.write("- No evidence of 1843 prosecuting attorney position establishments\n\n") f.write("SOURCES ANALYZED:\n") for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' not in content: f.write(f"‚úÖ {content.get('title', 'No title')}\n") f.write(f" URL: {content.get('url', 'No URL')}\n") f.write(f" Keywords: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}\n") else: f.write(f"‚ùå {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - {content.get('error', 'Error')}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("Based on analysis of publicly available web sources, no evidence was found\n") f.write("of New Jersey's 1823 state legislation mandating licensed attorneys as\n") f.write("prosecutors, nor any information about which county first implemented such\n") f.write("a requirement. The research question may refer to historical legislation\n") f.write("that is not documented in standard web sources.\n\n") f.write("RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FURTHER RESEARCH:\n") f.write("To definitively answer this question, researchers should consult:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey State Archives - Legislative records from 1823\n") f.write("2. New Jersey Statutes at Large - Historical compilation\n") f.write("3. County historical societies - Implementation records\n") f.write("4. Academic legal databases - HeinOnline, Westlaw historical\n") f.write("5. New Jersey Law Library - Historical collections\n") f.write("6. Rutgers Law School Archives - New Jersey legal history\n") print(f"üìã Final conclusion summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n\nüèÅ RESEARCH COMPLETE - FINAL CONCLUSION") print("=" * 60) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully analyzed {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)} web sources") print(f"üìä Found {len(relevant_findings)} relevant findings, {len(general_prosecutor_info)} general references") if not relevant_findings: print("\nüîç FINAL ANSWER: No evidence found in web sources of:") print(" ‚Ä¢ New Jersey 1823 legislation mandating licensed attorney prosecutors") print(" ‚Ä¢ Any county being first to implement such requirement") print(" ‚Ä¢ 1843 prosecuting attorney position establishments") print("\nüí° CONCLUSION: The research question may refer to historical legislation") print(" that requires specialized legal archives to verify and document.") print("\nüìö RECOMMENDATION: Contact New Jersey State Archives or academic") print(" law libraries for access to 1823 legislative records.") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references") print("üîç Requires follow-up research in specialized archives") else: print(f"‚ùå Scraped data file not found: {scraped_file}") print("Cannot proceed with analysis without scraped data")

Python Code python
import json import os import re from datetime import datetime # Load and inspect the scraped data file structure first scraped_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_scraped_20250807_090529.json' if os.path.exists(scraped_file): print("Loading scraped data file...") with open(scraped_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: scraped_data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure inspection:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(scraped_data.keys())}") print(f"Scraping timestamp: {scraped_data.get('scraping_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total sources: {scraped_data.get('total_sources', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") print("\n" + "="*80) print("ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION") print("="*80) # Initialize result containers relevant_findings = [] general_prosecutor_info = [] # Analyze each scraped source for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' in content: print(f"\n‚ùå Skipped {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - Error: {content.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") continue found_keywords = content.get('found_keywords', []) full_text = content.get('full_text', '').lower() title = content.get('title', 'No title') url = content.get('url', 'No URL') print(f"\nüîç Analyzing: {title}") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(found_keywords)}") print(f"Content length: {len(full_text)} characters") # Look for 1823 references with prosecutor context if '1823' in found_keywords: print(f"üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...") # Search for context around 1823 year_pattern = r'.{0,300}1823.{0,300}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"Context around 1823: ...{match.strip()[:400]}...") # FIX: Define context_lower BEFORE using it context_lower = match.lower() prosecutor_terms = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'legislation', 'mandated', 'required', 'licensed'] # Check if context mentions prosecutor/legal terms matching_terms = [term for term in prosecutor_terms if term in context_lower] if matching_terms: print(f"‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1823', 'context': match.strip(), 'matching_terms': matching_terms, 'relevance': 'high' }) else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è 1823 context does not mention prosecutor/legal terms") print(f" Context relates to: {context_lower[:200]}...") # Look for 1843 references (prosecuting attorney establishment) if '1843' in full_text: print(f"üìÖ Contains 1843 - examining for prosecuting attorney establishment...") year_pattern = r'.{0,300}1843.{0,300}' matches = re.findall(year_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: print(f"1843 context: ...{match.strip()[:400]}...") context_lower = match.lower() prosecutor_terms = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'established', 'office', 'county'] matching_terms = [term for term in prosecutor_terms if term in context_lower] if matching_terms: print(f"‚≠ê 1843 context mentions prosecutor establishment: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'year': '1843', 'context': match.strip(), 'matching_terms': matching_terms, 'relevance': 'medium' }) # Look for New Jersey prosecutor information if any(term in found_keywords for term in ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney']): print(f"üìã Contains prosecutor information - examining for NJ context...") # Search for New Jersey specific prosecutor information nj_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,200}(new jersey|nj).{0,200}(prosecutor|prosecuting attorney|county prosecutor).{0,200}' nj_matches = re.findall(nj_prosecutor_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in nj_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"NJ Prosecutor context: ...{context[:300]}...") # Check for specific NJ county mentions nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] context_lower = context.lower() mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context_lower] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Counties mentioned: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:500], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'nj_prosecutor_context' }) # Look for county information with legal context if 'county' in found_keywords: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Contains county information - checking for legal/prosecutor context...") # Search for county + legal terms combinations county_legal_pattern = r'.{0,200}(county).{0,200}(prosecutor|attorney|legislation|court|legal).{0,200}' county_matches = re.findall(county_legal_pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in county_matches: context = ' '.join(match) print(f"County-legal context: ...{context[:250]}...") # Check for specific NJ counties nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] context_lower = context.lower() mentioned_counties = [county for county in nj_counties if county in context_lower] if mentioned_counties: print(f"üéØ SPECIFIC NJ COUNTIES: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': title, 'url': url, 'context': context[:400], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'county_legal_context' }) print("-" * 70) # Summarize findings print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f"Sources analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}") print(f"Relevant findings (1823/1843 + prosecutor terms): {len(relevant_findings)}") print(f"General prosecutor/county information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}") if relevant_findings: print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT FINDINGS FOR NJ PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION:") print("=" * 60) for i, finding in enumerate(relevant_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Year: {finding['year']}") print(f" URL: {finding['url']}") print(f" Matching terms: {', '.join(finding['matching_terms'])}") print(f" Context: {finding['context'][:300]}...") print(f" Relevance: {finding['relevance']}") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No direct references to 1823 prosecutor legislation found") print(" The 1823 reference found relates to Attorney General Joseph Bloomfield's death date") print(" No evidence of 1823 legislation mandating licensed attorneys as prosecutors") if general_prosecutor_info: print(f"\nüìã GENERAL NJ PROSECUTOR/COUNTY INFORMATION:") print("=" * 50) for i, info in enumerate(general_prosecutor_info[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f"\n{i}. Source: {info['source']}") print(f" Type: {info.get('type', 'general')}") print(f" Context: {info['context'][:200]}...") if info.get('counties_mentioned'): print(f" Counties: {', '.join(info['counties_mentioned']).upper()}") # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_1823_legislation_final_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_focus': 'New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation and first county implementation', 'sources_analyzed': scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0), 'relevant_findings_count': len(relevant_findings), 'general_prosecutor_info_count': len(general_prosecutor_info), 'relevant_findings': relevant_findings, 'general_prosecutor_info': general_prosecutor_info, 'research_conclusion': 'No evidence found of 1823 NJ legislation mandating licensed attorney prosecutors in current web sources', 'research_status': 'Complete - requires specialized legal archives for historical legislation details' }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Complete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create final research summary with conclusions summary_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_conclusion.txt' with open(summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION RESEARCH - FINAL CONCLUSION\n") f.write("=" * 75 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Research completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Method: Web scraping analysis (SerpAPI quota exhausted)\n") f.write(f"Sources analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH QUESTION:\n") f.write("Which New Jersey county was first to implement the 1823 state legislation\n") f.write("that mandated licensed attorneys as prosecutors?\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH FINDINGS:\n") if relevant_findings: f.write(f"Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references:\n") for finding in relevant_findings: f.write(f"- {finding['year']}: {finding['source']}\n") f.write(f" Terms: {', '.join(finding['matching_terms'])}\n") f.write(f" Context: {finding['context'][:200]}...\n\n") else: f.write("‚ùå NO EVIDENCE FOUND of 1823 New Jersey legislation mandating licensed\n") f.write(" attorneys as prosecutors in the analyzed web sources.\n\n") f.write("KEY OBSERVATION:\n") f.write("- The 1823 reference found relates to Attorney General Joseph Bloomfield's\n") f.write(" death date (1753-1823), not to prosecutor legislation\n") f.write("- No references to county implementation of prosecutor requirements\n") f.write("- No evidence of 1843 prosecuting attorney position establishments\n\n") f.write("SOURCES ANALYZED:\n") for content in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' not in content: f.write(f"‚úÖ {content.get('title', 'No title')}\n") f.write(f" URL: {content.get('url', 'No URL')}\n") f.write(f" Keywords: {', '.join(content.get('found_keywords', []))}\n") else: f.write(f"‚ùå {content.get('url', 'Unknown')} - {content.get('error', 'Error')}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("Based on analysis of publicly available web sources, no evidence was found\n") f.write("of New Jersey's 1823 state legislation mandating licensed attorneys as\n") f.write("prosecutors, nor any information about which county first implemented such\n") f.write("a requirement. The research question may refer to historical legislation\n") f.write("that is not documented in standard web sources.\n\n") f.write("RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FURTHER RESEARCH:\n") f.write("To definitively answer this question, researchers should consult:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey State Archives - Legislative records from 1823\n") f.write("2. New Jersey Statutes at Large - Historical compilation\n") f.write("3. County historical societies - Implementation records\n") f.write("4. Academic legal databases - HeinOnline, Westlaw historical\n") f.write("5. New Jersey Law Library - Historical collections\n") f.write("6. Rutgers Law School Archives - New Jersey legal history\n") print(f"üìã Final conclusion summary saved to: {summary_file}") print(f"\n\nüèÅ RESEARCH COMPLETE - FINAL CONCLUSION") print("=" * 60) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully analyzed {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)} web sources") print(f"üìä Found {len(relevant_findings)} relevant findings, {len(general_prosecutor_info)} general references") if not relevant_findings: print("\nüîç FINAL ANSWER: No evidence found in web sources of:") print(" ‚Ä¢ New Jersey 1823 legislation mandating licensed attorney prosecutors") print(" ‚Ä¢ Any county being first to implement such requirement") print(" ‚Ä¢ 1843 prosecuting attorney position establishments") print("\nüí° CONCLUSION: The research question may refer to historical legislation") print(" that requires specialized legal archives to verify and document.") print("\nüìö RECOMMENDATION: Contact New Jersey State Archives or academic") print(" law libraries for access to 1823 legislative records.") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references") print("üîç Requires follow-up research in specialized archives") else: print(f"‚ùå Scraped data file not found: {scraped_file}") print("Cannot proceed with analysis without scraped data")

File structure inspection: Keys in data: ['scraping_timestamp', 'research_focus', 'total_sources', 'successful_scrapes', 'sources_scraped', 'scraped_content'] Scraping timestamp: 2025-08-07T09:05:29.015896 Total sources: 5 Successful scrapes: 4 ================================================================================ ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION ================================================================================ üîç Analyzing: Attorney General of New Jersey - Wikipedia Keywords found: 1823 Content length: 5000 characters üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context... Context around 1823: ...british loyalist force, the new jersey volunteers during the american revolutionary war.[4][5] post-independence[edit] # picture attorney general term in office party affiliation appointed by 1 william paterson[6](1745‚Äì1806) 1776‚Äì1783 federalist elected by the legislature 2 joseph bloomfield (1753‚Äì1823) 1783‚Äì1792 anti-administration elected by the legislature 3 aaron woodruff[7] 1792‚Äì1811 federali... ‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions: attorney Execution error: NameError: name 'found_keywords' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 102, in <module> File "<string>", line 102, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'found_keywords' is not defined

2025-08-07 09:10:47
Code Execution - Plan #1 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import json import os import re from datetime import datetime # Load and inspect the scraped data file structure first scraped_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_scraped_20250807_090529.json' if os.path.exists(scraped_file): print("Loading and inspecting scraped data file structure...") with open(scraped_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: scraped_data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure inspection:") print(f"Keys in main data: {list(scraped_data.keys())}") print(f"Scraping timestamp: {scraped_data.get('scraping_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total sources: {scraped_data.get('total_sources', 'N/A')}") print(f"Successful scrapes: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 'N/A')}") # Inspect the scraped_content structure if 'scraped_content' in scraped_data and len(scraped_data['scraped_content']) > 0: print(f"\nScraped content array length: {len(scraped_data['scraped_content'])}") print(f"First content item keys: {list(scraped_data['scraped_content'][0].keys())}") # Show overview of all scraped content print("\n" + "="*80) print("OVERVIEW OF ALL SCRAPED SOURCES:") print("="*80) for i, item in enumerate(scraped_data['scraped_content']): print(f"\nItem {i+1}:") print(f" Source number: {item.get('source_number', 'N/A')}") print(f" URL: {item.get('url', 'N/A')}") print(f" Title: {item.get('title', 'N/A')}") print(f" Has error: {'error' in item}") if 'error' not in item: print(f" Content length: {item.get('content_length', 0)}") print(f" Keywords found: {item.get('found_keywords', [])}") else: print(f" Error: {item.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") print("\n" + "="*80) print("ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION") print("="*80) # Initialize result containers relevant_findings = [] general_prosecutor_info = [] # Analyze each scraped source - using proper variable scoping for content_item in scraped_data['scraped_content']: # Skip items with errors if 'error' in content_item: print(f"\n‚ùå Skipping {content_item.get('url', 'Unknown')} - Error: {content_item.get('error', 'Unknown error')}") continue # Extract data safely from each content item item_keywords = content_item.get('found_keywords', []) item_text = content_item.get('full_text', '').lower() item_title = content_item.get('title', 'No title') item_url = content_item.get('url', 'No URL') item_length = len(item_text) print(f"\nüîç Analyzing: {item_title}") print(f"Keywords found: {', '.join(item_keywords)}") print(f"Content length: {item_length} characters") # Look for 1823 references with prosecutor context if '1823' in item_keywords: print(f"üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...") # Search for context around 1823 year_pattern = r'.{0,300}1823.{0,300}' year_matches = re.findall(year_pattern, item_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in year_matches: match_text = match.strip() print(f"Context around 1823: ...{match_text[:400]}...") # Check if context mentions prosecutor/legal terms match_lower = match_text.lower() prosecutor_terms = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'legislation', 'mandated', 'required', 'licensed'] # Find matching terms in this context matching_terms = [] for term in prosecutor_terms: if term in match_lower: matching_terms.append(term) if matching_terms: print(f"‚≠ê HIGHLY RELEVANT - 1823 context mentions: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': item_title, 'url': item_url, 'year': '1823', 'context': match_text, 'matching_terms': matching_terms, 'relevance': 'high' }) else: print(f"‚ÑπÔ∏è 1823 context does not mention prosecutor/legal terms") print(f" Context summary: {match_lower[:150]}...") # Look for 1843 references (prosecuting attorney establishment) if '1843' in item_text: print(f"üìÖ Contains 1843 - examining for prosecuting attorney establishment...") year_pattern = r'.{0,300}1843.{0,300}' year_matches = re.findall(year_pattern, item_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in year_matches: match_text = match.strip() print(f"1843 context: ...{match_text[:400]}...") match_lower = match_text.lower() prosecutor_terms = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting', 'attorney', 'established', 'office', 'county'] matching_terms = [] for term in prosecutor_terms: if term in match_lower: matching_terms.append(term) if matching_terms: print(f"‚≠ê 1843 context mentions prosecutor establishment: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") relevant_findings.append({ 'source': item_title, 'url': item_url, 'year': '1843', 'context': match_text, 'matching_terms': matching_terms, 'relevance': 'medium' }) # Look for New Jersey prosecutor information prosecutor_keywords = ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney'] has_prosecutor_keywords = any(keyword in item_keywords for keyword in prosecutor_keywords) if has_prosecutor_keywords: print(f"üìã Contains prosecutor information - examining for NJ context...") # Search for New Jersey specific prosecutor information nj_prosecutor_pattern = r'.{0,200}(new jersey|nj).{0,200}(prosecutor|prosecuting attorney|county prosecutor).{0,200}' nj_matches = re.findall(nj_prosecutor_pattern, item_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in nj_matches: context_text = ' '.join(match) print(f"NJ Prosecutor context: ...{context_text[:300]}...") # Check for specific NJ county mentions nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] context_lower = context_text.lower() mentioned_counties = [] for county in nj_counties: if county in context_lower: mentioned_counties.append(county) if mentioned_counties: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Counties mentioned: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': item_title, 'url': item_url, 'context': context_text[:500], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'nj_prosecutor_context' }) # Look for county information with legal context if 'county' in item_keywords: print(f"üèõÔ∏è Contains county information - checking for legal/prosecutor context...") # Search for county + legal terms combinations county_legal_pattern = r'.{0,200}(county).{0,200}(prosecutor|attorney|legislation|court|legal).{0,200}' county_matches = re.findall(county_legal_pattern, item_text, re.IGNORECASE) for match in county_matches: context_text = ' '.join(match) print(f"County-legal context: ...{context_text[:250]}...") # Check for specific NJ counties nj_counties = ['essex', 'bergen', 'hudson', 'morris', 'union', 'middlesex', 'somerset', 'hunterdon', 'mercer', 'monmouth', 'ocean', 'burlington', 'camden', 'gloucester', 'salem', 'cumberland', 'cape may', 'atlantic', 'passaic', 'sussex', 'warren'] context_lower = context_text.lower() mentioned_counties = [] for county in nj_counties: if county in context_lower: mentioned_counties.append(county) if mentioned_counties: print(f"üéØ SPECIFIC NJ COUNTIES: {', '.join(mentioned_counties).upper()}") general_prosecutor_info.append({ 'source': item_title, 'url': item_url, 'context': context_text[:400], 'counties_mentioned': mentioned_counties, 'type': 'county_legal_context' }) print("-" * 70) # Summarize findings print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f"Sources analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}") print(f"Relevant findings (1823/1843 + prosecutor terms): {len(relevant_findings)}") print(f"General prosecutor/county information: {len(general_prosecutor_info)}") if relevant_findings: print(f"\nüéØ RELEVANT FINDINGS FOR NJ PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION:") print("=" * 60) for i, finding in enumerate(relevant_findings, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Source: {finding['source']}") print(f" Year: {finding['year']}") print(f" URL: {finding['url']}") print(f" Matching terms: {', '.join(finding['matching_terms'])}") print(f" Context: {finding['context'][:300]}...") print(f" Relevance: {finding['relevance']}") else: print(f"\n‚ùå No direct references to 1823 prosecutor legislation found") print(" Analysis shows 1823 reference relates to Attorney General death date, not legislation") if general_prosecutor_info: print(f"\nüìã GENERAL NJ PROSECUTOR/COUNTY INFORMATION:") print("=" * 50) for i, info in enumerate(general_prosecutor_info[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. Source: {info['source']}") print(f" Type: {info.get('type', 'general')}") print(f" Context: {info['context'][:200]}...") if info.get('counties_mentioned'): print(f" Counties: {', '.join(info['counties_mentioned']).upper()}") # Save comprehensive analysis results analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_1823_legislation_final_analysis.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'research_focus': 'New Jersey 1823 prosecutor legislation and first county implementation', 'sources_analyzed': scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0), 'relevant_findings_count': len(relevant_findings), 'general_prosecutor_info_count': len(general_prosecutor_info), 'relevant_findings': relevant_findings, 'general_prosecutor_info': general_prosecutor_info, 'research_conclusion': 'No evidence found of 1823 NJ legislation mandating licensed attorney prosecutors in analyzed web sources', 'research_status': 'Complete - requires specialized legal archives for historical legislation details' }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüìÑ Complete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}") # Create final research conclusion conclusion_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_research_final_conclusion.txt' with open(conclusion_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION RESEARCH - FINAL CONCLUSION\n") f.write("=" * 75 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Research completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Method: Web scraping analysis (SerpAPI quota exhausted)\n") f.write(f"Sources successfully analyzed: {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)}\n\n") f.write("RESEARCH QUESTION:\n") f.write("Research the historical context of New Jersey's 1823 state legislation that\n") f.write("mandated licensed attorneys as prosecutors and identify which county was the\n") f.write("first to implement this requirement.\n\n") f.write("SOURCES ANALYZED:\n") for item in scraped_data['scraped_content']: if 'error' not in item: f.write(f"‚úÖ {item.get('title', 'No title')}\n") f.write(f" URL: {item.get('url', 'No URL')}\n") f.write(f" Keywords: {', '.join(item.get('found_keywords', []))}\n") else: f.write(f"‚ùå {item.get('url', 'Unknown')} - {item.get('error', 'Error')}\n") f.write("\n") f.write("RESEARCH FINDINGS:\n") if relevant_findings: f.write(f"Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references:\n") for finding in relevant_findings: f.write(f"- {finding['year']}: {finding['source']}\n") f.write(f" Terms: {', '.join(finding['matching_terms'])}\n") f.write(f" Context: {finding['context'][:200]}...\n\n") else: f.write("‚ùå NO EVIDENCE FOUND of New Jersey 1823 legislation mandating licensed\n") f.write(" attorneys as prosecutors in the analyzed web sources.\n\n") f.write("KEY OBSERVATION:\n") f.write("- The 1823 reference found relates to Attorney General Joseph Bloomfield's\n") f.write(" death date (1753-1823), not to prosecutor legislation\n") f.write("- No references to county implementation of prosecutor requirements\n") f.write("- No evidence of 1843 prosecuting attorney position establishments\n\n") f.write("CONCLUSION:\n") f.write("Based on comprehensive analysis of publicly available web sources, no evidence\n") f.write("was found of New Jersey's 1823 state legislation mandating licensed attorneys\n") f.write("as prosecutors, nor any information about which county first implemented such\n") f.write("a requirement. The research question may refer to historical legislation that\n") f.write("is not documented in standard web sources and requires specialized legal archives.\n\n") f.write("RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SPECIALIZED RESEARCH:\n") f.write("To definitively answer this historical question, researchers should consult:\n") f.write("1. New Jersey State Archives - Legislative records from 1823\n") f.write("2. New Jersey Statutes at Large - Historical compilation for 1823\n") f.write("3. County historical societies - Implementation records from 1823-1843\n") f.write("4. Academic legal databases - HeinOnline, Westlaw historical collections\n") f.write("5. New Jersey Law Library - Historical legal collections\n") f.write("6. Rutgers Law School Archives - New Jersey legal history research\n") f.write("7. New Jersey Historical Society - 19th century legal documentation\n") print(f"üìã Final conclusion saved to: {conclusion_file}") print(f"\n\nüèÅ RESEARCH ANALYSIS COMPLETE") print("=" * 50) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully analyzed {scraped_data.get('successful_scrapes', 0)} web sources") print(f"üìä Results: {len(relevant_findings)} relevant findings, {len(general_prosecutor_info)} general references") if not relevant_findings: print("\nüîç FINAL RESEARCH CONCLUSION:") print("‚ùå No evidence found in web sources of:") print(" ‚Ä¢ New Jersey 1823 legislation mandating licensed attorney prosecutors") print(" ‚Ä¢ Any county being first to implement such requirement") print(" ‚Ä¢ 1843 prosecuting attorney position establishments") print("\nüí° ASSESSMENT: The research question likely refers to historical legislation") print(" that requires specialized legal archives and historical records to verify.") print("\nüìö NEXT STEPS: Contact New Jersey State Archives, law libraries, or") print(" academic institutions with historical legal collections.") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ Found {len(relevant_findings)} potentially relevant references") print("üîç Requires follow-up research in specialized legal archives") else: print(f"‚ùå Scraped data file not found: {scraped_file}") print("Cannot proceed with analysis without scraped data")
Execution Output
Code Output: Loading and inspecting scraped data file structure... File structure inspection: Keys in main data: ['scraping_timestamp', 'research_focus', 'total_sources', 'successful_scrapes', 'sources_scraped', 'scraped_content'] Scraping timestamp: 2025-08-07T09:05:29.015896 Total sources: 5 Successful scrapes: 4 Scraped content array length: 5 First content item keys: ['source_number', 'url', 'title', 'content_length', 'found_keywords', 'full_text', 'scrape_timestamp'] ================================================================================ OVERVIEW OF ALL SCRAPED SOURCES: ================================================================================ Item 1: Source number: 1 URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Jersey_Attorney_General Title: Attorney General of New Jersey - Wikipedia Has error: False Content length: 13373 Keywords found: ['1823'] Item 2: Source number: 2 URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_New_Jersey Title: History of New Jersey - Wikipedia Has error: False Content length: 64001 Keywords found: ['county'] Item 3: Source number: 3 URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecutor Title: Prosecutor - Wikipedia Has error: False Content length: 58252 Keywords found: ['prosecutor', 'prosecuting attorney', 'county', 'legislation'] Item 4: Source number: 4 URL: https://www.nj.gov/oag/about/history.html Title: Access failed Has error: True Error: HTTP 404 Item 5: Source number: 5 URL: https://law.justia.com/constitution/new-jersey/ Title: New Jersey Constitution :: New Jersey Law :: US Law :: Justia Has error: False Content length: 155707 Keywords found: ['prosecutor', 'county', 'legislation'] ================================================================================ ANALYZING SCRAPED CONTENT FOR NEW JERSEY 1823 PROSECUTOR LEGISLATION ================================================================================ üîç Analyzing: Attorney General of New Jersey - Wikipedia Keywords found: 1823 Content length: 5000 characters üéØ CONTAINS 1823 - Examining for prosecutor legislation context...
