developer
2025-08-07 09:12:43
Development Plan #2
Plan Content:
Search for information about prosecuting attorney positions that were re-established in 1843 in New Jersey, focusing on elected positions and their connection to the 1900 Democratic National Convention. Look for New Jersey legal officials who served until 1898, were delegates to the 1900 Democratic National Convention, and held prosecuting attorney roles. Search for keywords including 'New Jersey prosecuting attorney 1898', '1900 Democratic National Convention New Jersey delegates', 'elected prosecutor New Jersey 1843', and 'Philippines annexation opposition 1900 Democratic platform'.

Plan Description:
This is the necessary pivot strategy because: (1) The previous search found no evidence of the 1823 legislation in standard web sources, suggesting we need to approach from a different angle, (2) We can work backwards from the 1900 Democratic National Convention and the 1898 service end date to identify the specific prosecuting attorney, (3) Expected outcome is to find New Jersey officials who were both prosecuting attorneys and convention delegates, (4) This alternative approach may lead us to the specific individual who fits all criteria, allowing us to then research their death date

Retrieved Episodic Memory Examples:
### Development Step 4: Identify Witnesses in 1933 Dillinger Fake-Credentials Jailbreak, Sheriff‚Äôs Death, and Pierpont-Bridgewater Convictions

**Description**: Search specifically for information about the 1933 jailbreak involving fake official credentials and a disputed escape plan found on John Dillinger that resulted in the death of a sheriff and led to Harry Pierpont's conviction. Focus on identifying who provided testimony in this case and cross-reference with any testimony that also helped convict other gang leaders from the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang. Search for keywords including '1933 jailbreak John Dillinger fake credentials', 'Harry Pierpont sheriff death conviction', 'Lima Ohio jail break 1933', 'Dillinger escape plan testimony', and 'witness testimony Pierpont conviction'.

**Use Cases**:
- Legal case preparation for defense attorneys researching witness testimony and trial records from the 1933 Dillinger jailbreak to identify procedural errors or new exculpatory evidence.
- Academic criminal history analysis for a university professor compiling and categorizing primary sources on Harry Pierpont‚Äôs conviction and related gang trials for a peer-reviewed journal article.
- True-crime journalism deep dive to automate aggregation of newspaper archives, court transcripts, and eyewitness accounts around the Lima, Ohio jailbreak and sheriff‚Äôs death for an investigative series.
- Museum exhibit content curation to source and verify authentic trial documents, testimonies, and photos for an interactive Prohibition-era crime display on John Dillinger and his associates.
- Genealogy and family-history research for descendants tracing ancestral connections to the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang through court records and witness lists from 1933.
- Digital archiving and preservation for a historical society automating the discovery and categorization of scanned legal filings, trial transcripts, and newspaper clippings relating to the sheriff‚Äôs shooting.
- Law-enforcement training module development to build detailed case studies on investigative techniques, fake credentials methods, and witness testimony cross-referencing used in the Pierpont trial for modern detective academies.

```
import os
import requests
import json
from datetime import datetime

# Get SerpAPI key from environment variables
api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")

if api_key is None:
print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.")
else:
print("API key found, proceeding with search for 1933 Dillinger jailbreak information...")
print("Target: Identify testimony that convicted Harry Pierpont and other gang leaders")
print("=" * 80)

# Define targeted search queries for the 1933 jailbreak case
search_queries = [
'1933 jailbreak John Dillinger fake credentials Harry Pierpont',
'Lima Ohio jail break 1933 sheriff death Harry Pierpont conviction',
'Dillinger escape plan testimony witness Harry Pierpont trial',
'Harry Pierpont conviction testimony 1933 jailbreak sheriff killed',
'Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang witness testimony convictions',
'1933 Lima Ohio jailbreak fake official credentials sheriff death',
'John Dillinger disputed escape plan Harry Pierpont trial testimony',
'witness testimony Pierpont conviction gang leaders 1933'
]

print(f"Starting comprehensive search with {len(search_queries)} targeted queries...")
print("Focus: 1933 jailbreak, fake credentials, sheriff death, Harry Pierpont conviction, witness testimony")
print("=" * 80)

# Store all search results for analysis
all_results = []

# Perform searches with different targeted queries
for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1):
print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}")
print("-" * 70)

# Prepare API request parameters
params = {
"q": query,
"api_key": api_key,
"engine": "google",
"google_domain": "google.com",
"safe": "off",
"num": 12, # Get sufficient results for comprehensive analysis
"type": "search"
}

try:
# Make API request to SerpAPI
response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30)

if response.status_code == 200:
results = response.json()

if results.get("organic_results"):
print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for search {i}")

# Process and display key results
for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1):
title = result.get('title', 'No title')
link = result.get('link', 'No link')
snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet')

print(f"\nResult {j}:")
print(f"Title: {title}")
print(f"Link: {link}")
print(f"Snippet: {snippet}")

# Store result with search context
all_results.append({
'search_number': i,
'query_text': query,
'result_number': j,
'title': title,
'link': link,
'snippet': snippet
})

# Highlight potentially relevant results
combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}"
key_indicators = ['testimony', 'witness', 'trial', 'conviction', 'pierpont', 'sheriff', '1933', 'lima', 'jailbreak']
if sum(1 for term in key_indicators if term in combined_text) >= 3:
print("üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT - Contains multiple key terms!")

print("-" * 40)
else:
print(f"No organic results found for search {i}: '{query}'")
all_results.append({
'search_number': i,
'query_text': query,
'result_number': 0,
'title': 'No results',
'link': 'N/A',
'snippet': 'No results found for this query'
})

else:
print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}")

except Exception as e:
print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}")
continue

print("\n" + "=" * 80)

# Save comprehensive search results to workspace
timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
results_file = f"workspace/dillinger_1933_jailbreak_search_{timestamp}.json"

with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump({
'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
'search_focus': '1933 Dillinger jailbreak, fake credentials, Harry Pierpont conviction, witness testimony',
'total_queries': len(search_queries),
'total_results': len(all_results),
'queries_executed': search_queries,
'all_search_results': all_results
}, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY:")
print(f"Total targeted queries executed: {len(search_queries)}")
print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}")
print(f"Search results saved to: {results_file}")

# Analyze results for key testimony and conviction information
print("\n\nüîç ANALYZING RESULTS FOR KEY TESTIMONY AND CONVICTION DETAILS:")
print("=" * 70)

# Look for results specifically mentioning testimony, trials, or convictions
testimony_results = []
pierpont_results = []
lima_jailbreak_results = []

for result in all_results:
if result['title'] == 'No results':
continue

title_lower = result['title'].lower()
snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower()
combined = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}"

# Categorize results by relevance
if any(term in combined for term in ['testimony', 'witness', 'trial', 'testified']):
testimony_results.append(result)

if 'pierpont' in combined:
pierpont_results.append(result)

if any(term in combined for term in ['lima', 'jailbreak', '1933']):
lima_jailbreak_results.append(result)

print(f"\nüìã CATEGORIZED RESULTS:")
print(f"Results mentioning testimony/witnesses: {len(testimony_results)}")
print(f"Results mentioning Harry Pierpont: {len(pierpont_results)}")
print(f"Results mentioning Lima/jailbreak/1933: {len(lima_jailbreak_results)}")

# Display most promising results for testimony identification
print("\n\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR TESTIMONY IDENTIFICATION:")
print("=" * 60)

if testimony_results:
print("\nüìù TESTIMONY-RELATED RESULTS:")
for i, result in enumerate(testimony_results[:5], 1): # Show top 5
print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}")
print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}")
print(f" Link: {result['link']}")
print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}")
print(f" Search #{result['search_number']}, Result #{result['result_number']}")

if pierpont_results:
print("\n\nüë§ HARRY PIERPONT-RELATED RESULTS:")
for i, result in enumerate(pierpont_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3
print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}")
print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}")
print(f" Link: {result['link']}")
print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}")

print(f"\n\nüìÅ Next step: Analyze detailed results in {results_file}")
print("üéØ Goal: Identify specific witness who testified in Harry Pierpont's conviction")
print("üîç Focus: Cross-reference testimony that convicted multiple gang leaders")
print("\nüèÅ Search phase complete - ready for detailed analysis of historical testimony records!")
```

### Development Step 5: Testimony in 1933 Dillinger Jailbreak and Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern Gang Convictions

**Description**: Search specifically for information about the 1933 jailbreak involving fake official credentials and a disputed escape plan found on John Dillinger that resulted in the death of a sheriff and led to Harry Pierpont's conviction. Focus on identifying who provided testimony in this case and cross-reference with any testimony that also helped convict other gang leaders from the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang. Search for keywords including '1933 jailbreak John Dillinger fake credentials', 'Harry Pierpont sheriff death conviction', 'Lima Ohio jail break 1933', 'Dillinger escape plan testimony', and 'witness testimony Pierpont conviction'.

**Use Cases**:
- Legal research teams automating archival retrieval of witness testimony and court records to support precedent analysis in organized crime defense cases
- True-crime podcast producers aggregating and fact-checking 1930s jailbreak narratives and witness statements via API calls for immersive episode scripting
- Academic historians cross-referencing digital newspaper archives and trial transcripts to reconstruct the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang‚Äôs network for a peer-reviewed journal article
- Law enforcement cold-case units integrating JSON-formatted witness metadata and snippet analysis to uncover new leads in unsolved sheriff homicide investigations
- Educational technology platforms generating interactive timelines of historical jailbreak events by extracting dates, locations, and key participants from court document repositories
- Digital humanities researchers employing automated keyword searches and snippet classification to map testimony patterns across multiple 1930s bank robbery trials
- Investigative journalists conducting rapid background checks on historical criminal figures by cross-referencing API-fetched search results with court verdict data
- Insurance risk assessment teams analyzing historical crime incident data and witness testimony to model liability exposure for high-risk property underwriting

```
import json
import os
from datetime import datetime

# First, let's inspect the existing search results file to understand its structure
results_file = 'workspace/dillinger_1933_jailbreak_search_20250110_200146.json'

if os.path.exists(results_file):
print("Found existing search results file. Inspecting structure...")

with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
data = json.load(f)

print("File structure:")
print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}")
print(f"Search timestamp: {data.get('search_timestamp', 'N/A')}")
print(f"Total queries: {data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}")
print(f"Total results: {data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}")

if 'all_search_results' in data and len(data['all_search_results']) > 0:
print(f"\nFirst result structure:")
first_result = data['all_search_results'][0]
print(f"Keys in result: {list(first_result.keys())}")

print("\n" + "="*90)
print("ANALYZING EXISTING RESULTS FOR KEY TESTIMONY INFORMATION")
print("="*90)

# Extract and analyze the key findings from the interrupted search
ed_shouse_mentions = []
testimony_results = []
pierpont_conviction_results = []

for result in data['all_search_results']:
if result.get('title') == 'No results':
continue

title = result.get('title', '').lower()
snippet = result.get('snippet', '').lower()
combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}"

# Look for Ed Shouse mentions (key witness identified in previous search)
if 'ed shouse' in combined_text or 'shouse' in combined_text:
ed_shouse_mentions.append(result)
print(f"\nüéØ ED SHOUSE TESTIMONY REFERENCE FOUND:")
print(f"Title: {result.get('title', '')}")
print(f"Snippet: {result.get('snippet', '')}")
print(f"Link: {result.get('link', '')}")
print(f"Query: {result.get('query_text', '')}")
print("-" * 50)

# Look for testimony-related results
if any(term in combined_text for term in ['testimony', 'testified', 'witness', 'trial']):
testimony_results.append(result)

# Look for Pierpont conviction results
if 'pierpont' in combined_text and any(term in combined_text for term in ['conviction', 'convicted', 'sentenced', 'death']):
pierpont_conviction_results.append(result)

print(f"\n\nüìä ANALYSIS OF EXISTING SEARCH RESULTS:")
print(f"Ed Shouse mentions found: {len(ed_shouse_mentions)}")
print(f"Testimony-related results: {len(testimony_results)}")
print(f"Pierpont conviction results: {len(pierpont_conviction_results)}")

# Display key findings about Ed Shouse testimony
if ed_shouse_mentions:
print("\n\nüîç KEY FINDING - ED SHOUSE TESTIMONY DETAILS:")
print("=" * 60)
for result in ed_shouse_mentions:
print(f"\nSource: {result.get('title', '')}")
print(f"Content: {result.get('snippet', '')}")
print(f"Link: {result.get('link', '')}")
print("-" * 40)

# Now continue with the remaining 4 searches that were interrupted
print("\n\nüîÑ CONTINUING WITH REMAINING TARGETED SEARCHES...")
print("="*90)

else:
print("No existing search results found. Need to run initial search first.")
data = {'all_search_results': []}

# Continue with the remaining searches (searches 5-8 from the original plan)
api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")

if api_key:
# Remaining search queries from the original plan
remaining_queries = [
'Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang witness testimony convictions',
'1933 Lima Ohio jailbreak fake official credentials sheriff death',
'John Dillinger disputed escape plan Harry Pierpont trial testimony',
'witness testimony Pierpont conviction gang leaders 1933'
]

print(f"\nExecuting {len(remaining_queries)} remaining targeted searches...")

# Get existing results to continue the numbering
existing_results = data.get('all_search_results', [])
search_start_number = 5 # Continue from search 5

for i, query in enumerate(remaining_queries, search_start_number):
print(f"\nSearch {i}/8: {query}")
print("-" * 70)

params = {
"q": query,
"api_key": api_key,
"engine": "google",
"google_domain": "google.com",
"safe": "off",
"num": 12,
"type": "search"
}

try:
import requests
response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30)

if response.status_code == 200:
results = response.json()

if results.get("organic_results"):
print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for search {i}")

for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1):
title = result.get('title', 'No title')
link = result.get('link', 'No link')
snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet')

print(f"\nResult {j}:")
print(f"Title: {title}")
print(f"Link: {link}")
print(f"Snippet: {snippet}")

# Add to existing results
existing_results.append({
'search_number': i,
'query_text': query,
'result_number': j,
'title': title,
'link': link,
'snippet': snippet
})

# Check for key testimony indicators
combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}"
key_indicators = ['ed shouse', 'testimony', 'witness', 'trial', 'conviction', 'pierpont', 'makley', 'clark']
matching_terms = [term for term in key_indicators if term in combined_text]

if len(matching_terms) >= 3:
print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT - Contains: {', '.join(matching_terms)}")

# Special highlight for Ed Shouse mentions
if 'shouse' in combined_text:
print("‚≠ê ED SHOUSE TESTIMONY REFERENCE!")

print("-" * 40)
else:
print(f"No organic results found for search {i}: '{query}'")
existing_results.append({
'search_number': i,
'query_text': query,
'result_number': 0,
'title': 'No results',
'link': 'N/A',
'snippet': 'No results found for this query'
})

else:
print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}")

except Exception as e:
print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}")
continue

print("\n" + "=" * 90)

# Update and save the complete search results
complete_data = {
'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
'search_focus': '1933 Dillinger jailbreak, fake credentials, Harry Pierpont conviction, witness testimony - COMPLETE',
'total_queries': 8,
'total_results': len(existing_results),
'queries_executed': data.get('queries_executed', []) + remaining_queries,
'all_search_results': existing_results
}

# Save updated results
complete_results_file = f"workspace/dillinger_1933_jailbreak_complete_{datetime.now().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}.json"

with open(complete_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump(complete_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f"\n\nüìä COMPLETE SEARCH SUMMARY:")
print(f"Total queries executed: 8/8")
print(f"Total results collected: {len(existing_results)}")
print(f"Complete results saved to: {complete_results_file}")

# Final analysis focusing on Ed Shouse testimony
print("\n\nüéØ FINAL ANALYSIS - ED SHOUSE TESTIMONY FINDINGS:")
print("=" * 70)

# Collect all Ed Shouse references from complete results
all_shouse_refs = []
all_testimony_refs = []
gang_conviction_refs = []

for result in existing_results:
if result.get('title') == 'No results':
continue

title = result.get('title', '').lower()
snippet = result.get('snippet', '').lower()
combined = f"{title} {snippet}"

if 'shouse' in combined:
all_shouse_refs.append(result)

if any(term in combined for term in ['testimony', 'testified', 'witness']):
all_testimony_refs.append(result)

if any(name in combined for name in ['pierpont', 'makley', 'clark']) and 'convicted' in combined:
gang_conviction_refs.append(result)

print(f"\nüìã FINAL TESTIMONY ANALYSIS:")
print(f"Ed Shouse references found: {len(all_shouse_refs)}")
print(f"Total testimony references: {len(all_testimony_refs)}")
print(f"Gang conviction references: {len(gang_conviction_refs)}")

# Create comprehensive testimony summary
testimony_summary = f"""
üéØ COMPREHENSIVE TESTIMONY FINDINGS:

KEY WITNESS IDENTIFIED: ED SHOUSE
- Former gang member who provided crucial testimony
- Helped convict Harry Pierpont, Charles Makley, and Russell Clark
- Testimony was instrumental in their conviction for Sheriff Jess Sarber's murder
- All three were sentenced to death based on this testimony

1933 LIMA OHIO JAILBREAK DETAILS:
- Date: October 12, 1933
- Location: Allen County Jail, Lima, Ohio
- Victim: Sheriff Jess Sarber
- Method: Gang posed as police officers with fake transfer request/credentials
- Outcome: Successful jailbreak freeing John Dillinger, Sheriff Sarber killed

CONVICTIONS BASED ON ED SHOUSE TESTIMONY:
1. Harry Pierpont - Convicted of murder, executed October 17, 1934
2. Charles Makley - Convicted of murder, killed during escape attempt September 22, 1934
3. Russell Clark - Convicted of murder, sentenced to death (later commuted)

CROSS-REFERENCE: Ed Shouse's testimony helped convict multiple gang leaders from the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang, making him the key witness whose testimony resulted in convictions of several gang members.

Search completed: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}
"""

print(testimony_summary)

# Save the comprehensive analysis
analysis_file = 'workspace/ed_shouse_testimony_analysis.txt'
with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
f.write(testimony_summary)

print(f"\nüìÑ Comprehensive testimony analysis saved to: {analysis_file}")

else:
print("No API key available for remaining searches")

print("\nüèÅ SEARCH MISSION COMPLETE!")
print("The witness who provided testimony that convicted Harry Pierpont and other gang leaders:")
print("\nüéØ **ED SHOUSE** - Former gang member whose testimony helped convict Pierpont, Makley, and Clark")
```

### Development Step 2: Identify Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern Gang and Their Major 1924 Indiana Heist and 1934 Black Hudson Robbery

**Description**: Conduct a comprehensive web search to identify the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang and their criminal activities, focusing on their first major heist in Indiana in 1924 and the 1934 bank robbery that was John Dillinger's last robbery involving a black Hudson getaway car. Search for keywords including 'Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang', 'John Dillinger 1934 last robbery black Hudson', 'Indiana bank robbery 1924', 'Harry Pierpont gang', and 'Dillinger gang bank robberies'. Extract information about gang members, their criminal activities, and any testimony that led to convictions of gang leaders.

**Use Cases**:
- Law enforcement cold-case investigations: Automate archival web searches to uncover overlooked testimonies and newspaper reports on the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang‚Äôs 1924 Indiana heist for potential case re-evaluation.
- Museum exhibit curation: Compile period-accurate titles, snippets, and timelines about John Dillinger‚Äôs 1934 black Hudson getaway car robbery to design curated panels and interactive displays on Prohibition-era crime.
- Documentary film research: Rapidly extract organic search results, links, and contextual snippets around Harry Pierpont‚Äôs first major heist in Indiana and Dillinger‚Äôs last bank job for accurate on-screen narration and archival footage sourcing.
- Academic criminology thesis support: Systematically gather and categorize primary source links, gang member details, and court-testimony evidence to analyze organized crime evolution for a graduate dissertation.
- Genealogical investigation service: Validate ancestral claims by cross-referencing family lore of involvement in 1924 bank robberies with online newspaper archives and conviction records retrieved through focused queries.
- Legal due-diligence for heritage property developers: Investigate historical criminal events tied to Indiana landmarks by extracting documented heist details and trial outcomes to inform restoration impact reports.
- Interactive crime-map application: Integrate geotagged data from search results on 1924 and 1934 robberies to build a public-facing web tool visualizing key gang activity locations and dates across Midwestern towns.

```
import os
import json
from datetime import datetime

# First, let's check if the search results file was created from the previous execution
results_file = 'workspace/pierpont_bridgewater_northern_gang_search_results.json'

if os.path.exists(results_file):
print("Found existing search results file. Let's inspect its structure first...")

# Inspect the file structure before processing
with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
try:
data = json.load(f)
print("\nFile structure inspection:")
print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}")
print(f"Search timestamp: {data.get('search_timestamp', 'N/A')}")
print(f"Total queries: {data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}")
print(f"Total results: {data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}")

if 'results' in data and len(data['results']) > 0:
print(f"\nFirst result structure:")
first_result = data['results'][0]
print(f"Keys in result: {list(first_result.keys())}")
print(f"Sample result preview: {first_result}")

print("\nFile structure confirmed. Proceeding with analysis...")

except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
print(f"Error reading JSON file: {e}")
print("File may be corrupted or incomplete. Will proceed with new search.")
data = None
else:
print("No existing search results file found.")
data = None

# Since the previous search was interrupted, let's run a more focused search
# with better error handling and timeout management
import requests

api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY")

if api_key is None:
print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.")
else:
print("\n" + "="*80)
print("CONDUCTING FOCUSED SEARCH FOR PIERPONT-BRIDGEWATER-NORTHERN GANG")
print("="*80)

# More focused search queries with better timeout handling
focused_queries = [
'"Harry Pierpont" gang Indiana bank robbery 1924',
'John Dillinger last bank robbery 1934 Hudson car',
'"Pierpont gang" criminal activities Indiana heists',
'Dillinger gang members testimony convictions 1934'
]

all_focused_results = []

for i, query in enumerate(focused_queries, 1):
print(f"\nFocused Search {i}/{len(focused_queries)}: {query}")
print("-" * 60)

params = {
"q": query,
"api_key": api_key,
"engine": "google",
"google_domain": "google.com",
"safe": "off",
"num": 10, # Reduced number for faster response
"type": "search"
}

try:
# Shorter timeout to avoid hanging
response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=15)

if response.status_code == 200:
results = response.json()

if results.get("organic_results"):
print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results")

for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1):
title = result.get('title', 'No title')
link = result.get('link', 'No link')
snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet')

print(f"\nResult {j}:")
print(f"Title: {title}")
print(f"Snippet: {snippet}")
print(f"Link: {link}")

# Check for key gang-related terms
combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}"
gang_terms = ['pierpont', 'dillinger', 'hudson', 'bank robbery', 'indiana', '1924', '1934', 'gang', 'heist']

matching_terms = [term for term in gang_terms if term in combined_text]
if matching_terms:
print(f"üéØ RELEVANT - Contains: {', '.join(matching_terms)}")

# Store result
all_focused_results.append({
'query_number': i,
'query_text': query,
'result_number': j,
'title': title,
'link': link,
'snippet': snippet,
'matching_terms': matching_terms
})

print("-" * 40)
else:
print(f"No results found for query: '{query}'")

else:
print(f"API request failed with status {response.status_code}")
if response.text:
print(f"Error details: {response.text[:200]}...")

except requests.exceptions.Timeout:
print(f"Timeout occurred for query {i}. Moving to next query.")
except Exception as e:
print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}")

print("\n" + "="*80)

# Save focused search results
focused_results_file = 'workspace/focused_gang_search_results.json'
with open(focused_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump({
'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
'search_type': 'focused_gang_search',
'search_purpose': 'Identify Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang with improved timeout handling',
'total_queries': len(focused_queries),
'total_results': len(all_focused_results),
'queries': focused_queries,
'results': all_focused_results
}, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f"\n\nüìä FOCUSED SEARCH SUMMARY:")
print(f"Total focused queries executed: {len(focused_queries)}")
print(f"Total focused results collected: {len(all_focused_results)}")
print(f"Focused results saved to: {focused_results_file}")

# Analyze the most relevant results
print("\n\nüéØ ANALYZING MOST RELEVANT RESULTS:")
print("="*50)

highly_relevant = []
for result in all_focused_results:
if len(result.get('matching_terms', [])) >= 2: # Results with 2+ matching terms
highly_relevant.append(result)

if highly_relevant:
print(f"Found {len(highly_relevant)} highly relevant results:")
for i, result in enumerate(highly_relevant, 1):
print(f"\nHighly Relevant Result {i}:")
print(f"Query: {result['query_text']}")
print(f"Title: {result['title']}")
print(f"Snippet: {result['snippet']}")
print(f"Matching terms: {', '.join(result['matching_terms'])}")
print(f"Link: {result['link']}")
print("-" * 40)
else:
print("No highly relevant results found with multiple matching terms.")

# Create analysis summary
analysis_file = 'workspace/gang_analysis_summary.txt'
with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
f.write("PIERPONT-BRIDGEWATER-NORTHERN GANG SEARCH ANALYSIS\n")
f.write("="*55 + "\n\n")
f.write(f"Analysis conducted: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n")
f.write(f"Focused queries executed: {len(focused_queries)}\n")
f.write(f"Total results collected: {len(all_focused_results)}\n")
f.write(f"Highly relevant results: {len(highly_relevant)}\n\n")

f.write("SEARCH OBJECTIVES STATUS:\n")
f.write("1. Identify the Pierpont-Bridgewater-Northern gang - IN PROGRESS\n")
f.write("2. Find 1924 Indiana heist information - SEARCHING\n")
f.write("3. Locate 1934 Dillinger last robbery with Hudson - SEARCHING\n")
f.write("4. Extract gang member details - SEARCHING\n")
f.write("5. Find conviction testimony - SEARCHING\n\n")

if highly_relevant:
f.write("HIGHLY RELEVANT FINDINGS:\n")
for i, result in enumerate(highly_relevant, 1):
f.write(f"{i}. {result['title']}\n")
f.write(f" Terms: {', '.join(result['matching_terms'])}\n")
f.write(f" Link: {result['link']}\n\n")

f.write("Next steps: Continue analysis of search results for specific gang information.\n")

print(f"\nAnalysis summary saved to: {analysis_file}")
print("\n‚úÖ Focused search completed successfully with improved error handling!")
```
developer
2025-08-07 09:13:46
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 1)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.") else: print("API key found, proceeding with search for New Jersey prosecuting attorney information...") print("Target: Find NJ legal officials who served until 1898 and were delegates to 1900 Democratic Convention") print("=" * 90) # Define targeted search queries for New Jersey prosecuting attorneys and 1900 Democratic Convention search_queries = [ 'New Jersey prosecuting attorney 1898 elected position', '1900 Democratic National Convention New Jersey delegates', 'elected prosecutor New Jersey 1843 re-established', 'Philippines annexation opposition 1900 Democratic platform New Jersey', 'New Jersey prosecutor delegate Democratic Convention 1900', 'NJ prosecuting attorney served until 1898 Democratic delegate', 'New Jersey legal officials 1900 Democratic National Convention Kansas City', 'prosecuting attorney New Jersey 1843-1898 Democratic politics' ] print(f"Starting comprehensive search with {len(search_queries)} targeted queries...") print("Focus: NJ prosecuting attorneys (1843-1898), 1900 Democratic Convention delegates, Philippines opposition") print("=" * 90) # Store all search results for analysis all_results = [] # Perform searches with different targeted queries for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Prepare API request parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 12, # Get sufficient results for comprehensive analysis "type": "search" } try: # Make API request to SerpAPI response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for search {i}") # Process and display key results for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('link', 'No link') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Store result with search context all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet }) # Highlight potentially relevant results combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_indicators = ['prosecuting attorney', 'prosecutor', 'democratic convention', '1900', '1898', 'new jersey', 'delegate', 'philippines', 'annexation'] matching_terms = [term for term in key_indicators if term in combined_text] if len(matching_terms) >= 3: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT - Contains: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") # Special highlight for specific combinations if ('prosecuting attorney' in combined_text or 'prosecutor' in combined_text) and ('1900' in combined_text or '1898' in combined_text): print("‚≠ê PROSECUTOR + DATE MATCH - Very promising!") if 'democratic convention' in combined_text and 'new jersey' in combined_text: print("üèõÔ∏è NJ DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION CONNECTION!") print("-" * 50) else: print(f"No organic results found for search {i}: '{query}'") all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': 0, 'title': 'No results', 'link': 'N/A', 'snippet': 'No results found for this query' }) else: print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}") continue print("\n" + "=" * 90) # Save comprehensive search results to workspace timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") results_file = f"workspace/nj_prosecutor_1900_democratic_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'New Jersey prosecuting attorneys (1843-1898) and 1900 Democratic National Convention delegates', 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_results), 'queries_executed': search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Total targeted queries executed: {len(search_queries)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") print(f"Search results saved to: {results_file}") # Analyze results for key prosecutor and convention information print("\n\nüîç ANALYZING RESULTS FOR KEY PROSECUTOR AND CONVENTION DETAILS:") print("=" * 80) # Categorize results by relevance prosecutor_results = [] convention_results = [] philippines_results = [] nj_legal_results = [] for result in all_results: if result['title'] == 'No results': continue title_lower = result['title'].lower() snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() combined = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Categorize results by relevance if any(term in combined for term in ['prosecuting attorney', 'prosecutor', 'district attorney']): prosecutor_results.append(result) if any(term in combined for term in ['democratic convention', '1900 convention', 'democratic national']): convention_results.append(result) if any(term in combined for term in ['philippines', 'annexation', 'imperialism', 'anti-imperialist']): philippines_results.append(result) if 'new jersey' in combined and any(term in combined for term in ['legal', 'attorney', 'prosecutor', 'court']): nj_legal_results.append(result) print(f"\nüìã CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Results mentioning prosecutors/attorneys: {len(prosecutor_results)}") print(f"Results mentioning Democratic Convention: {len(convention_results)}") print(f"Results mentioning Philippines/annexation: {len(philippines_results)}") print(f"Results mentioning NJ legal officials: {len(nj_legal_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR PROSECUTOR IDENTIFICATION:") print("=" * 70) if prosecutor_results: print("\n‚öñÔ∏è PROSECUTOR-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(prosecutor_results[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f" Search #{result['search_number']}, Result #{result['result_number']}") if convention_results: print("\n\nüèõÔ∏è DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(convention_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if philippines_results: print("\n\nüåè PHILIPPINES ANNEXATION-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(philippines_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") # Look for specific name patterns that might indicate individual prosecutors print("\n\nüîç SCANNING FOR INDIVIDUAL PROSECUTOR NAMES:") print("=" * 50) potential_names = [] for result in all_results: if result['title'] == 'No results': continue combined_text = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Look for patterns that might indicate names (capitalized words) import re # Find potential names (2+ capitalized words together) name_patterns = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+ [A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)?\b', combined_text) for name in name_patterns: # Filter out common non-name phrases if not any(skip in name.lower() for skip in ['new jersey', 'united states', 'democratic party', 'supreme court']): potential_names.append({ 'name': name, 'context': result['snippet'][:100] + '...', 'source': result['title'] }) if potential_names: print(f"Found {len(potential_names)} potential individual names:") unique_names = list({name['name']: name for name in potential_names}.values())[:10] # Show unique names, limit to 10 for name_info in unique_names: print(f"‚Ä¢ {name_info['name']} - Context: {name_info['context']}") print(f" Source: {name_info['source']}") print() print(f"\n\nüìÅ Next step: Analyze detailed results in {results_file}") print("üéØ Goal: Identify specific NJ prosecutor who served until 1898 and was 1900 Democratic delegate") print("üîç Focus: Cross-reference prosecuting attorney positions with Democratic Convention attendance") print("\nüèÅ Initial search phase complete - ready for detailed analysis of historical records!")

Execution failed - All 8 search queries failed with HTTP 429 error 'Your account has run out of searches', indicating the SerpAPI quota has been exhausted. The code structure and logic are correct, but no actual search results were obtained due to API limitations. Recommended fix: Either wait for API quota reset, upgrade the SerpAPI plan, or implement an alternative search approach using different APIs (like Wikipedia API, Archive.org API) or web scraping methods that don't rely on the exhausted SerpAPI quota.
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime # Get SerpAPI key from environment variables api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("Error: Missing API key. Make sure you have SERPAPI_API_KEY in your environment variables.") else: print("API key found, proceeding with search for New Jersey prosecuting attorney information...") print("Target: Find NJ legal officials who served until 1898 and were delegates to 1900 Democratic Convention") print("=" * 90) # Define targeted search queries for New Jersey prosecuting attorneys and 1900 Democratic Convention search_queries = [ 'New Jersey prosecuting attorney 1898 elected position', '1900 Democratic National Convention New Jersey delegates', 'elected prosecutor New Jersey 1843 re-established', 'Philippines annexation opposition 1900 Democratic platform New Jersey', 'New Jersey prosecutor delegate Democratic Convention 1900', 'NJ prosecuting attorney served until 1898 Democratic delegate', 'New Jersey legal officials 1900 Democratic National Convention Kansas City', 'prosecuting attorney New Jersey 1843-1898 Democratic politics' ] print(f"Starting comprehensive search with {len(search_queries)} targeted queries...") print("Focus: NJ prosecuting attorneys (1843-1898), 1900 Democratic Convention delegates, Philippines opposition") print("=" * 90) # Store all search results for analysis all_results = [] # Perform searches with different targeted queries for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Prepare API request parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 12, # Get sufficient results for comprehensive analysis "type": "search" } try: # Make API request to SerpAPI response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results for search {i}") # Process and display key results for j, result in enumerate(results["organic_results"], 1): title = result.get('title', 'No title') link = result.get('link', 'No link') snippet = result.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\nResult {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Link: {link}") print(f"Snippet: {snippet}") # Store result with search context all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet }) # Highlight potentially relevant results combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()}" key_indicators = ['prosecuting attorney', 'prosecutor', 'democratic convention', '1900', '1898', 'new jersey', 'delegate', 'philippines', 'annexation'] matching_terms = [term for term in key_indicators if term in combined_text] if len(matching_terms) >= 3: print(f"üéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT - Contains: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") # Special highlight for specific combinations if ('prosecuting attorney' in combined_text or 'prosecutor' in combined_text) and ('1900' in combined_text or '1898' in combined_text): print("‚≠ê PROSECUTOR + DATE MATCH - Very promising!") if 'democratic convention' in combined_text and 'new jersey' in combined_text: print("üèõÔ∏è NJ DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION CONNECTION!") print("-" * 50) else: print(f"No organic results found for search {i}: '{query}'") all_results.append({ 'search_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': 0, 'title': 'No results', 'link': 'N/A', 'snippet': 'No results found for this query' }) else: print(f"Error: API request failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during search {i}: {str(e)}") continue print("\n" + "=" * 90) # Save comprehensive search results to workspace timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") results_file = f"workspace/nj_prosecutor_1900_democratic_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'New Jersey prosecuting attorneys (1843-1898) and 1900 Democratic National Convention delegates', 'total_queries': len(search_queries), 'total_results': len(all_results), 'queries_executed': search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Total targeted queries executed: {len(search_queries)}") print(f"Total results collected: {len(all_results)}") print(f"Search results saved to: {results_file}") # Analyze results for key prosecutor and convention information print("\n\nüîç ANALYZING RESULTS FOR KEY PROSECUTOR AND CONVENTION DETAILS:") print("=" * 80) # Categorize results by relevance prosecutor_results = [] convention_results = [] philippines_results = [] nj_legal_results = [] for result in all_results: if result['title'] == 'No results': continue title_lower = result['title'].lower() snippet_lower = result['snippet'].lower() combined = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower}" # Categorize results by relevance if any(term in combined for term in ['prosecuting attorney', 'prosecutor', 'district attorney']): prosecutor_results.append(result) if any(term in combined for term in ['democratic convention', '1900 convention', 'democratic national']): convention_results.append(result) if any(term in combined for term in ['philippines', 'annexation', 'imperialism', 'anti-imperialist']): philippines_results.append(result) if 'new jersey' in combined and any(term in combined for term in ['legal', 'attorney', 'prosecutor', 'court']): nj_legal_results.append(result) print(f"\nüìã CATEGORIZED RESULTS:") print(f"Results mentioning prosecutors/attorneys: {len(prosecutor_results)}") print(f"Results mentioning Democratic Convention: {len(convention_results)}") print(f"Results mentioning Philippines/annexation: {len(philippines_results)}") print(f"Results mentioning NJ legal officials: {len(nj_legal_results)}") # Display most promising results print("\n\nüéØ MOST PROMISING RESULTS FOR PROSECUTOR IDENTIFICATION:") print("=" * 70) if prosecutor_results: print("\n‚öñÔ∏è PROSECUTOR-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(prosecutor_results[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f" Search #{result['search_number']}, Result #{result['result_number']}") if convention_results: print("\n\nüèõÔ∏è DEMOCRATIC CONVENTION-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(convention_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if philippines_results: print("\n\nüåè PHILIPPINES ANNEXATION-RELATED RESULTS:") for i, result in enumerate(philippines_results[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['query_text']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") # Look for specific name patterns that might indicate individual prosecutors print("\n\nüîç SCANNING FOR INDIVIDUAL PROSECUTOR NAMES:") print("=" * 50) potential_names = [] for result in all_results: if result['title'] == 'No results': continue combined_text = f"{result['title']} {result['snippet']}" # Look for patterns that might indicate names (capitalized words) import re # Find potential names (2+ capitalized words together) name_patterns = re.findall(r'\b[A-Z][a-z]+ [A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)?\b', combined_text) for name in name_patterns: # Filter out common non-name phrases if not any(skip in name.lower() for skip in ['new jersey', 'united states', 'democratic party', 'supreme court']): potential_names.append({ 'name': name, 'context': result['snippet'][:100] + '...', 'source': result['title'] }) if potential_names: print(f"Found {len(potential_names)} potential individual names:") unique_names = list({name['name']: name for name in potential_names}.values())[:10] # Show unique names, limit to 10 for name_info in unique_names: print(f"‚Ä¢ {name_info['name']} - Context: {name_info['context']}") print(f" Source: {name_info['source']}") print() print(f"\n\nüìÅ Next step: Analyze detailed results in {results_file}") print("üéØ Goal: Identify specific NJ prosecutor who served until 1898 and was 1900 Democratic delegate") print("üîç Focus: Cross-reference prosecuting attorney positions with Democratic Convention attendance") print("\nüèÅ Initial search phase complete - ready for detailed analysis of historical records!")

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 2)

Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime # Since SerpAPI quota is exhausted, let's try alternative approaches # First, let's inspect the empty results file to understand the structure results_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_1900_democratic_search_20250110_200146.json' if os.path.exists(results_file): print("Found existing search results file. Inspecting structure...") with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: try: data = json.load(f) print("\nFile structure inspection:") print(f"Keys in data: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"Search timestamp: {data.get('search_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total queries: {data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total results: {data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}") if 'all_search_results' in data and len(data['all_search_results']) > 0: print(f"\nFirst result structure:") first_result = data['all_search_results'][0] print(f"Keys in result: {list(first_result.keys())}") else: print("\nNo search results found in file - confirming API quota exhaustion") except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Error reading JSON file: {e}") else: print("No existing search results file found.") print("\n" + "="*90) print("ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: WIKIPEDIA API SEARCH FOR NJ PROSECUTING ATTORNEYS") print("="*90) # Since SerpAPI is exhausted, let's try Wikipedia API for historical information # Wikipedia often has detailed historical information about legal officials and political conventions wikipedia_queries = [ "New Jersey prosecuting attorney history 1843", "1900 Democratic National Convention delegates", "New Jersey legal system 19th century", "Philippines annexation opposition Democratic Party 1900", "New Jersey prosecutors 1898" ] wikipedia_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(wikipedia_queries, 1): print(f"\nWikipedia Search {i}/{len(wikipedia_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 70) try: # Wikipedia API search endpoint wiki_search_url = "https://en.wikipedia.org/api/rest_v1/page/search" params = { 'q': query, 'limit': 10 } headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; ResearchBot/1.0)' } response = requests.get(wiki_search_url, params=params, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get('pages'): print(f"Found {len(results['pages'])} Wikipedia articles") for j, page in enumerate(results['pages'], 1): title = page.get('title', 'No title') description = page.get('description', 'No description') extract = page.get('extract', 'No extract') page_id = page.get('id', 'No ID') print(f"\nWikipedia Result {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Description: {description}") print(f"Extract: {extract}") print(f"Page ID: {page_id}") # Check for relevant terms combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {description.lower()} {extract.lower()}" key_terms = ['prosecuting attorney', 'prosecutor', 'democratic convention', '1900', '1898', 'new jersey', 'delegate', 'philippines'] matching_terms = [term for term in key_terms if term in combined_text] if matching_terms: print(f"üéØ RELEVANT - Contains: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") # Store result wikipedia_results.append({ 'query_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'description': description, 'extract': extract, 'page_id': page_id, 'matching_terms': matching_terms }) print("-" * 40) else: print(f"No Wikipedia results found for: '{query}'") else: print(f"Wikipedia API request failed with status {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during Wikipedia search {i}: {str(e)}") continue print("\n" + "="*90) # Try Archive.org API for historical documents print("\nALTERNATIVE APPROACH: ARCHIVE.ORG SEARCH FOR HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS") print("="*70) archive_queries = [ "New Jersey prosecuting attorney 1898", "Democratic National Convention 1900 New Jersey", "Philippines annexation Democratic Party 1900" ] archive_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(archive_queries, 1): print(f"\nArchive.org Search {i}/{len(archive_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 60) try: # Internet Archive search API archive_url = "https://archive.org/advancedsearch.php" params = { 'q': query, 'fl[]': ['identifier', 'title', 'description', 'date', 'creator'], 'rows': 10, 'page': 1, 'output': 'json' } response = requests.get(archive_url, params=params, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get('response', {}).get('docs'): docs = results['response']['docs'] print(f"Found {len(docs)} Archive.org documents") for j, doc in enumerate(docs, 1): title = doc.get('title', 'No title') description = doc.get('description', ['No description']) if isinstance(description, list): description = ' '.join(description[:2]) # Take first 2 descriptions date = doc.get('date', 'No date') creator = doc.get('creator', ['Unknown']) if isinstance(creator, list): creator = ', '.join(creator[:2]) # Take first 2 creators identifier = doc.get('identifier', 'No ID') print(f"\nArchive Result {j}:") print(f"Title: {title}") print(f"Description: {description}") print(f"Date: {date}") print(f"Creator: {creator}") print(f"Identifier: {identifier}") # Check for relevant terms combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {description.lower()}" key_terms = ['prosecuting attorney', 'prosecutor', 'democratic convention', '1900', '1898', 'new jersey'] matching_terms = [term for term in key_terms if term in combined_text] if matching_terms: print(f"üéØ RELEVANT - Contains: {', '.join(matching_terms)}") # Store result archive_results.append({ 'query_number': i, 'query_text': query, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'description': description, 'date': date, 'creator': creator, 'identifier': identifier, 'matching_terms': matching_terms }) print("-" * 40) else: print(f"No Archive.org results found for: '{query}'") else: print(f"Archive.org API request failed with status {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"Error during Archive.org search {i}: {str(e)}") continue # Save alternative search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") alternative_results_file = f"workspace/nj_prosecutor_alternative_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(alternative_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Alternative APIs (Wikipedia + Archive.org)', 'reason': 'SerpAPI quota exhausted - using alternative sources', 'wikipedia_queries': len(wikipedia_queries), 'wikipedia_results': len(wikipedia_results), 'archive_queries': len(archive_queries), 'archive_results': len(archive_results), 'total_alternative_results': len(wikipedia_results) + len(archive_results), 'wikipedia_search_results': wikipedia_results, 'archive_search_results': archive_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n\nüìä ALTERNATIVE SEARCH SUMMARY:") print(f"Wikipedia queries executed: {len(wikipedia_queries)}") print(f"Wikipedia results collected: {len(wikipedia_results)}") print(f"Archive.org queries executed: {len(archive_queries)}") print(f"Archive.org results collected: {len(archive_results)}") print(f"Total alternative results: {len(wikipedia_results) + len(archive_results)}") print(f"Alternative search results saved to: {alternative_results_file}") # Analyze the most relevant results from alternative sources print("\n\nüîç ANALYZING ALTERNATIVE SEARCH RESULTS:") print("="*60) # Combine all alternative results for analysis all_alternative_results = wikipedia_results + archive_results # Find highly relevant results highly_relevant = [] for result in all_alternative_results: if len(result.get('matching_terms', [])) >= 2: highly_relevant.append(result) if highly_relevant: print(f"\nüéØ HIGHLY RELEVANT RESULTS FROM ALTERNATIVE SOURCES:") print(f"Found {len(highly_relevant)} highly relevant results:") for i, result in enumerate(highly_relevant, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f" Source: {'Wikipedia' if 'extract' in result else 'Archive.org'}") print(f" Query: {result.get('query_text', 'N/A')}") print(f" Matching terms: {', '.join(result.get('matching_terms', []))}") if 'extract' in result: # Wikipedia result print(f" Extract: {result.get('extract', 'N/A')[:200]}...") else: # Archive.org result print(f" Description: {result.get('description', 'N/A')[:200]}...") print(f" Date: {result.get('date', 'N/A')}") print("-" * 50) else: print("\nNo highly relevant results found from alternative sources.") print("May need to try more specific queries or different approaches.") # Create analysis summary analysis_file = 'workspace/nj_prosecutor_alternative_analysis.txt' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write("NEW JERSEY PROSECUTING ATTORNEY ALTERNATIVE SEARCH ANALYSIS\n") f.write("="*65 + "\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis conducted: {datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Reason: SerpAPI quota exhausted, using alternative sources\n\n") f.write("SEARCH METHODS USED:\n") f.write(f"1. Wikipedia API - {len(wikipedia_queries)} queries, {len(wikipedia_results)} results\n") f.write(f"2. Archive.org API - {len(archive_queries)} queries, {len(archive_results)} results\n") f.write(f"Total alternative results: {len(all_alternative_results)}\n\n") f.write("SEARCH OBJECTIVES STATUS:\n") f.write("1. Find NJ prosecuting attorney positions re-established 1843 - SEARCHING\n") f.write("2. Identify legal officials who served until 1898 - SEARCHING\n") f.write("3. Find 1900 Democratic Convention NJ delegates - SEARCHING\n") f.write("4. Connect prosecutor + delegate roles - SEARCHING\n") f.write("5. Philippines annexation opposition connection - SEARCHING\n\n") if highly_relevant: f.write("HIGHLY RELEVANT FINDINGS FROM ALTERNATIVE SOURCES:\n") for i, result in enumerate(highly_relevant, 1): f.write(f"{i}. {result.get('title', 'No title')}\n") f.write(f" Source: {'Wikipedia' if 'extract' in result else 'Archive.org'}\n") f.write(f" Terms: {', '.join(result.get('matching_terms', []))}\n\n") else: f.write("No highly relevant results found from alternative sources.\n") f.write("Recommendation: Try more specific historical databases or genealogy sites.\n\n") f.write("NEXT STEPS:\n") f.write("1. Analyze Wikipedia articles for specific prosecutor names\n") f.write("2. Check Archive.org documents for 1900 convention records\n") f.write("3. Consider genealogy databases or historical society records\n") f.write("4. Look for New Jersey state archives or legal history resources\n") print(f"\nAnalysis summary saved to: {analysis_file}") print("\n‚úÖ Alternative search approach completed!") print("üîç Next: Analyze specific Wikipedia articles and Archive.org documents for prosecutor details") print("üéØ Goal: Find NJ prosecutor who served until 1898 and was 1900 Democratic delegate")
Execution Output

He ran for the Senate again in 1970 and lost 00:54:00 again but by that time he had gained wider recognition over the next 00:54:07 8 years he was appointed to 00:54:10 a series of government positions he was ambassador to the United Nations 00:54:17 he was chairman of the Republican National Committee. He was America's 00:54:22 representative in China before the 2 countries had diplomatic relations 00:54:29 and he was head of the Central Intelligence Agency. In 00:54:35 1980 Bush ran against Ronald Reagan for the Republican nomination for President 00:54:42 Bush last but became Reagan's running mate. After 2 terms as vice 00:54:49 president he felt ready to lead the nation himself the new president took 7 00:54:55 foreign trips during his 1st year in office in Europe Bush met with the 00:55:02 other leaders of NATO the North Atlantic Treaty Organization he proposed 00:55:08 a major agreement on reducing troops and non-nuclear weapons in Europe 00:55:16 but Soviet Union considered his proposal an important step in the right direction. 00:55:28 I'm in June of 1989 but Chinese government sent 00:55:35 tanks and troops to crush pro-democracy protests in Tiananmen Square in 00:55:42 Beijing hundreds and perhaps thousands of demonstrators were killed. 00:55:49 President Bush took some steps against China but many critics felt the sanctions 00:55:55 were not strong enough. 00:56:04 In Central and Eastern Europe communist governments also faced protests 00:56:11 since 1987 Sylvia leader Mikhail Gorbachev had let countries in the 00:56:17 Warsaw Pact experiment with Politico and economic reforms. 00:56:24 But those reforms were not enough to stop the fall of communist governments in one 00:56:31 country after another. In the summer of 1989 President Bush 00:56:37 visited Hungary and Poland both nations were trying to develop free market 00:56:44 economies both were suffering as they moved away from central control. 00:56:53 In Poland the leader of the Solidarity trade union Lech Bolland's I led the push 00:57:00 for reform and the other mothers of young women this year. And would later become 00:57:07 president of 00:57:08 a democratic Poland and I was. Used to this is the daughter found Xeon me to talk 00:57:14 shop. The 00:37:13 English language has many expressions that describe 00:37:18 a fast moving event some expressions relate to body movements 00:37:25 we say something happens in the blink of an eye or in 00:37:30 a heartbeat other expressions are related to the world of nature 00:37:38 today we will talk about 00:37:40 a speed related expression involving an animal. Now because we are talking 00:37:46 about speed and animals you might think it is 00:37:51 a big cat such as a lion or a cheetah or maybe even 00:37:57 a small but speedy animal such as 00:38:01 a hare but it is none of them. But 00:38:14 why lambs are cute but they are not really known for their lightning speed 00:38:22 well are expression is about 00:38:24 a specific part of the animal its tail I suspect lambs 00:38:31 can shake their tails very fast because when something happens quickly we say it 00:38:38 happens in 2 shakes of 00:38:39 a lamb's tail here is an example I'm going to the store I'll be back in 00:38:46 2 shakes of a lamb's tail this expression is 00:38:51 a cuter and more descriptive way of saying quickly maybe instead of sending 00:38:57 a text message with the letters b r 00:39:00 b be right back we could use the image of 00:39:04 a lamb shaking its tail that would be fun being cute like 00:39:11 a lamb may be fun but it has its drawbacks cute things 00:39:18 are often not taken seriously and this cute factor is the main 00:39:24 reason Americans rarely use 2 shakes of a lamb's tail in 00:39:30 a serious situation for example if I see a person get hit by 00:39:36 a car I would not say hold on help will be here in 2 shakes of 00:39:42 a lamb's tail. A new study has 00:30:42 found that babies have 00:30:44 a higher chance of dying in their 1st few weeks of life if their mothers live 00:30:50 close to an oil spill researchers studied information about 00:30:57 babies dying and oil spills in the Niger Delta area of southern 00:31:04 Nigeria the researchers described their results as shocking 00:31:11 the study comes from scientists from the University of St gallon in Switzerland 00:31:19 they found that babies born in the Niger Delta were 2 times as likely to die 00:31:26 in the 1st month of life if their mothers lived close to an oil spill before they 00:31:33 became pregnant Nigeria is one of the largest oil producers and 00:31:40 Africa and oil spills are common there. An 00:31:46 estimated 240000 barrels of unprocessed or crude 00:31:53 petroleum oil are spilled into the Niger Delta every year 00:32:00 the environmental effects are clear to see waterways covered with black liquid 00:32:07 animals that cannot breathe and dying trees and plants along the coast 00:32:15 now the effects on human health are becoming evident The researchers 00:32:21 compared information on 6600 recent oil spills 00:32:28 with results from Nigeria's 2013 demographic and health survey 00:32:36 the study showed that even spills taking place 5 years before the women 00:32:43 became pregnant doubled the chances of their babies dying after birth 00:32:50 however spills that happened during pregnancy appeared to have little effect 00:32:58 unborn and newborn babies are thought to be at 00:33:02 a greater risk as their bodies have yet to build up natural defenses 00:33:09 but the researchers say more studies are needed to show how crude oil affects 00:33:16 health crude oil is 00:33:19 a mix of complex hydrocarbons substances found in oil 00:33:25 coal and gas some are harmful to human health so 00:33:32 a 2nd line of research would be to examine what parts of crude oil are the 00:33:39 most harmful for both adults and newborns. The new study 00:33:46 suggests that the effects of oil spills will continue for many years 00:33:53 after they happen in 2015 oil company Royal Dutch Shell 00:33:59 agreed to share the costs of cleaning up its oil spills and the Niger Delta 00:34:07 the United Nations says the cleanup work will likely take 30 years 00:34:15 critics say the company has paid just 00:34:18 a very small amount of the money it promised for the effort shell 00:34:25 blames oil thieves for causing many of the spills the Nigerian 00:34:31 government is the majority owner of the Shell Petroleum development company which 00:34:38 directs most of Royal Dutch Shell operations in Nigeria I'm 00:34:45 Alex Bryant. 00:34:54 A Leonardo da Vinci painting of Jesus Christ that recently sold for 00:35:00 a record $450000000.00 is heading to the Louve Abu Dhabi 00:35:08 the 500 year old painting is called Salvatore Marandi Latin for 00:35:15 savior of the world it is one of fewer than 20 to Vinci 00:35:21 paintings known to exist the Louve Abu Dhabi opened 00:35:27 a Nov 11th the waterfront museum in the United Arab Emirates 00:35:34 capital city includes Middle Eastern objects and paintings as well as works 00:35:42 by Western artists. As we heard last time one of the issues 00:45:45 they discussed was slavery the existence of slavery affected 00:45:52 decisions like how to count the national population it also affected the 00:45:59 powers proposed for Congress the delegates at the convention accepted 00:46:05 several political compromises on the issue web slavery one 00:46:11 compromise was the 3 fifths rule the population would be counted every 00:46:18 10 years to decide how many members each state would hand in the House 00:46:25 of Representatives in Congress with the 3 fifths rule the delegates 00:46:32 agreed that every 5 slaves would be counted as 3 people. 00:46:39 Another compromise would allow states to import slaves until the year 00:46:46 1808 after that no news slaves would be brought into the 00:46:52 country many of the delegates in Philadelphia did not like these compromises 00:47:00 but they knew the compromises would keep the southern states where slavery was most 00:47:06 widespread from leaving the convention after all the debates 00:47:13 better arguments sand the compromises the delegates were nearing the end of their 00:47:19 work for months had passed since the convention began the 00:47:26 weather had been hot emotions had been hot too but that was expected 00:47:33 after all the men in Philadelphia and the delegates were all men were deciding the 00:47:39 future of their country what. 00:47:48 Early in September the convention appointed 5 delegates to 00:47:53 a committee of style it was their job to write the document 00:47:59 containing all the decisions made at the convention the chairman of the committee 00:48:07 was William Samual Johnson of Connecticut the other members were 00:48:13 Alexander Hamilton of New York governor Marise of Pennsylvania Rufus 00:48:20 King of Massachusetts and James Madison of Virginia of these 00:48:26 5 men Gouverneur Morris was known for the beauty of his language so 00:48:33 Johnson asked him to write the constitution. Here in Washington 00:48:39 visitors to the National Archives can read and the original old copy of the United 00:48:45 States Constitution. And Potter at the National Archives says this is 00:48:52 hers are often surprised that the document is only 4 pages long the irony 00:48:59 is that the pages are actually nearly 3 feet long and about 2 feet wide they're 00:49:05 written on parchment in other words they're written on animal skin using an iron 00:49:10 gall ink and this particular document was created in September of 00:49:15 1787. The convention 00:49:22 approved $23.00 articles for the Constitution. Or as we wrote them 00:49:29 in simpler form so there were just 7 the document itself is divided by 00:49:36 article on each article focuses on 00:49:38 a different aspect of the American government article describes the powers of the 00:49:44 Congress and explains how to count the population for purposes of 00:49:50 representation and it states who can become senators or representatives 00:49:57 and how long they can serve. Article 2 describes the powers of the 00:50:04 president explains the requirements for they are 1st and how the president is 00:50:11 to be elected. Article 3 describes the powers of the federal 00:50:17 judiciary which includes the Supreme Court and all of the district and 00:50:23 circuit courts Leanne Potter at the National Archives explains that part of our 00:50:30 government make sure that the laws that the legislative branch creates and are 00:50:35 being enforced by the executive branch are in fact constitutional In other words 00:50:40 that the laws they create are legal themselves. 00:50:52 The 1st 3 articles provide 00:50:55 a system of checks and balances the purpose is to prevent any of the 00:51:02 3 branches of government legislative executive or judicial from becoming 00:51:08 too powerful article 4 explains the right sand duties of the states 00:51:15 under the new central government Article 5 provides 00:51:21 a system for amending the Constitution Article 6 declares the 00:51:27 Constitution to be the highest law of the land. And Article 7 00:51:34 simply says the constitution will be 00:51:37 a step placed when 9 states approve it. The 00:51:43 members of the convention wrote 00:51:45 a preamble for the Constitution it began We the undersigned 00:51:52 delegates the states of New Hampshire Massachusetts and so on it listed 00:51:59 all 13 states by name. The committee of style did not think it was 00:52:06 a good idea to list each state. After all Rhode Island never 00:52:12 sent the delegate to Philadelphia and no one knew for sure if every 00:52:19 state would approve the constitution so Governor Morris wrote instead 00:52:26 we the people love the United States of America. Those simple 00:52:32 words solve the problem but they caused angry debate during the fight to 00:52:39 approve 00:52:40 a constitution they made clear that the power of the central government came 00:52:47 not from the States but directly from the citizens of the nation. 00:52:55 Modern day Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas came from 00:52:59 a family descended from slaves he grew up in the southern state of Georgia 00:53:07 Justice Thomas recalled having to memorize the opening statement to the 00:53:12 Constitution when he was 00:53:15 a child I was that it's so fascinating to think of these black kids in the 00:53:20 segregated students of reciting the preamble to the Constitution of the United 00:53:26 States would have me believe I mean everything so obviously in front of you is 00:53:30 wrong you can't go to the public library you can't live in certain neighborhoods 00:53:36 you can't go to certain schools but the spite all of that you lived in an 00:53:41 environment of people who said it was still our birthright to be included. 00:53:49 The rest of the preamble states why the Constitution was written in order to form 00:53:55 a more perfect Union establish Justice insure domestic 00:54:02 Tranquility provide for the common defense promote the general Welfare 00:54:09 and secure the Blessings of Liberty to ourselves and our Posterity do 00:54:15 ordain and establish this Constitution for the United States of America. 00:54:25 The next step was to signed that document on September 17th that 00:54:32 delegates gathered for the last time one might think all of their business finally 00:54:38 was done but nothing any O'Gara I'm of Massachusetts rose to speak. 00:54:45 If it was not too late he said he would like to make get change instead of 00:54:52 electing one representative for every 40000 people as agreed he 00:54:58 suggested changing but number to 30000. Go rooms proposal 00:55:05 could have caused 00:55:06 a bitter argument van suddenly George Washington the president of the 00:55:13 convention stood up but delegates were surprised he had said Little all 00:55:20 summer now George Washington rose to express his support for the proposed change 00:55:27 he said it would guarantee you 00:55:29 a greater voice in the government for the people of the nation.
